title: Data Analyst
description: At Coinbase, our mission is to increase economic freedom around the world, and we couldn’t do this without hiring the best people. We’re a group of hard-working overachievers who are deeply focused on building the future of finance and Web3 for our users across the globe, whether they’re trading, storing, staking or using crypto. Know those people who always lead the group project? That’s us.<p><br></p>There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for candidates who will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, and disrupt ourselves. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people who are excited to learn about and live crypto, because those are the folks who enjoy the intense moments in our sprint and recharge work culture. We’re a remote-first company looking to hire the absolute best talent all over the world.<p><br></p><strong>Ready to #LiveCrypto? Who you are:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You’ve got positive energy. You’re optimistic about the future and determined to get there. </li><li>You’re never tired of learning. You want to be a pro in bleeding edge tech like DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, and Web 3.0. </li><li>You appreciate direct communication. You’re both an active communicator and an eager listener - because let’s face it, you can’t have one without the other. You’re cool with candid feedback and see every setback as an opportunity to grow.</li><li>You can pivot on the fly. Crypto is constantly evolving, so our priorities do, too. What you worked on last month may not be what you work on today, and that excites you. You’re not looking for a boring job.</li><li>You have a “can do” attitude. Our teams create high-quality work on quick timelines. Owning a problem doesn’t scare you, but rather empowers you to take 100% responsibility for achieving our mission.</li><li>You want to be part of a winning team. We’re stronger together, and you’re a person who embraces being pushed out of your comfort zone. </li></ul><p><br></p>The Coinbase Customer Experience (CX) organization plays an imperative role in achieving our mission. Our team is dedicated to eliminating customer challenges, empowering our global user base via self-service and automation, and optimizing customer support interactions to build an effortless experience. As a Data Analyst on our team, you will help drive business impact through data. You’ll have the opportunity to transform data into valuable business insights and help shape our strategy to deliver maximum impact to our customers, while also heavily influencing strategy, planning, and execution.<p><br></p><strong>What you’ll be doing (ie. job duties):</strong><strong> To be completed by all business teams except Eng.</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Improve customer experiences by developing bar raising metrics, self-service tools, and deep analyses that drive actionable insights</li><li>Collaborate with stakeholders to manage a long-term analytic roadmap that balances the tactical and strategic needs of the business</li><li>Proactively identify opportunity areas for improvement including deep dive investigations and processes to better serve our customers</li><li>Drive the vision, building, and adoption of self-service analytic capabilities; develop these capabilities at scale</li><li>Understand data resources and know when, how, and which best to use for each project</li><li>Ability to frame and break down complex business problems into key components and recommend practical solutions</li><li>Monitor key performance metrics and use data to identify actionable opportunities to increase efficiency and make high-quality decisions that drive performance improvements</li><li>Build a collaborative team environment that fosters efficient execution, innovation, and continuous improvement</li><li>Develop and support the analytical technologies that give our team timely, flexible, and structured access to their data</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What we look for in you (ie. job requirements):</strong><strong> To be completed by all business teams except Eng. </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>3+ years of relevant experience</li><li>Advanced SQL and data modeling skills, Python experience a plus</li><li>Proficient using at least one data visualization product (Looker, Tableau, QuickSight, etc.)</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required, including experience meeting with and communicating information to senior leadership</li><li>Highly collaborative, with an ability to optimally secure inputs from many cross-functional partner teams</li><li>Ability to think strategically, formulate appropriate analytical solutions, and execute in order to solve business needs</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice To Haves</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Report automation experience (e.g. using Python, R)</li><li>Knowledge of AWS services and cloud computing</li><li>Experience with descriptive and inferential statistics</li><li>Experience with financial industry regulations</li><li>Experience with customer support metrics/data</li></ul><p><br></p>Pay Transparency Notice: Depending on your work location, the target annual salary for this position can range from $131,325 to $154,500 + target bonus + target equity + benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)).<p><br></p><strong>Pay Transparency Notice:</strong> Depending on your work location, the target annual salary for this position can range as detailed below. Full time offers from Coinbase also include target bonus + target equity + benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)).<p><br></p><strong><u>Pay Range</u></strong><p><br></p>$131,325—$154,500 USD<p><br></p>Commitment to Equal Opportunity<p><br></p>Coinbase is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected by applicable law. Coinbase will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. For US applicants, you may view Pay Transparency, Employee Rights and Know Your Rights notices by clicking on their corresponding links. Additionally, Coinbase participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.<p><br></p>Coinbase is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations[at]coinbase.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. For quick access to screen reading technology compatible with this site click here to download a free compatible screen reader (free step by step tutorial can be found here).<p><br></p>Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants<p><br></p>Depending on your location, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) may regulate the way we manage the data of job applicants. Our full notice outlining how data will be processed as part of the application procedure for applicable locations is available here. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required. For US applicants only, by submitting your application you are agreeing to arbitration of disputes as outlined here.

title: Data Analyst
description: SUMMARY – The Data Analysts collaborates with Engineers, QA, Data Scientists and Product team members using scrum methodology. The teams operate on a 2-week sprint cycle and are responsible for delivering new features and enhancements for our products that include things like data visualizations, analytical insights, and incorporating new data sources/tables/fields to our consumption model. The analysts also collaborate with our advisory and customer success team members to resolve bugs, identify long term solutions, and discuss requirements for new ideas.<p><br></p><strong>Key Duties And Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design and build publication-ready data visualizations using diverse sets of structured and unstructured data.</li><li>Build interactive dashboards and reports that provide insights that can be easily interpreted and applied by business leaders to help improve client performance.</li><li>Provides data analysis and model development support for the deployment of Pareto’s software solutions.</li><li>Reasons independently to synthesize raw data into digestible and actionable information.</li><li>Works to continually develop and further Pareto’s quantitative and modeling skills, capabilities, and client offerings. </li><li>Collaborates with product management, client advisory, data science and operations on product visualizations, enhancements and debugging issues.</li><li>Contributes to requirements gathering and recommendations that align with best practices and future state design.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Other Duties And Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Responsible for compliance with all federal, state, and local laws, rules and regulations affecting Pareto.</li><li>Responsible for participating in quality assurance, compliance and in-service and continuing education activities as requested by Pareto.</li><li>Responsible for performing other duties and responsibilities as required.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>WORK ENVIRONMENT</strong><p><br></p>Work takes place in a standard office environment. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit and use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk. Tasks involve the ability reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.<p><br></p>This position is 100% remote. Employee located in Chicago must be a minimum of one time per week in the office.<p><br></p><strong>DISCLAIMER</strong><p><br></p>This job description describes the typical duties and responsibilities associated with the identified job. It does not include all duties and responsibilities of the position. The listing of the duties and responsibilities are not necessarily in the order of their relative importance.<p><br></p><strong>About Us</strong><p><br></p><strong>EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BS or BA degree in business, economics, finance, accounting, marketing analytics, MIS, computer science, engineering, healthcare field with proven experience exhibiting data and analytical proficiency.</li><li>1+ years of data visualization experience using Tableau, Qlik, Power BI or Looker.</li><li>3+ years of experience with analytics, database, or business intelligence in the healthcare field.</li><li>3+ years of Strong SQL querying experience both creating and updating and stored procedures.</li><li>Experience with Python (i.e. Jupyter).</li><li>Experience with statistical software SAS.</li><li>Healthcare Payer and/or Provider experience with claims, clinical and or quality data.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills.</li><li>Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.</li><li>Excellent documentation skills.</li><li>Excellent problem-solving skills.</li><li>Team player.</li><li>Ability to provide clear and accurate information through multiple media.</li><li>Ability to manage time effectively with strong attention to detail.</li><li>Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.</li><li>Ability to interact politely, tactfully and firmly with a wide range of people and personalities.</li><li>Ability to work in an environment with potential interruptions.</li><li>Ability to manage multiple simultaneous tasks with individual timeframes and priorities.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Computer Equipment And Software Requirements</strong><p><br></p>This position requires the ability to work with a personal computer in a Windows environment. Must possess strong familiarity with office software including Teams, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook. Experience with Jupyter Hub &amp; EMR Studio and Statistical software SAS<p><br></p><ul><li>Pareto utilizes Tableau for data visualization</li><li>Microsoft SQL Server</li><li>GitHub</li><li>Jira &amp; Confluence</li><li>Lucid Chart</li></ul>

title: Data Analyst
description: <ul><li>Job Description*</li><li>The primary roll will be to take over some of our business-as-usual work while we turn our attention to other activities. However, they will also be involved in some other related analytical work.</li><li>Job Duties/Responsibilities *</li><li>Leads/participates in the design, implementation and management of new analytics &amp; reporting solutions.</li><li>Designs, develops, and implements innovative analytical solutions.</li><li>Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports.</li><li>Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide subject matter insights and recommendations.</li><li>Structures and assembles data into multi-dimensions with various granularities (e.g., demographics, customers, products, transactions).</li><li>Integrates information from multiple sources to enable more efficient processes, enhanced analysis and/or streamlined reporting.</li><li>Builds, refreshes and maintains reports and visualizations to effectively communicate data driven insights to users for a variety of audiences e.g. visualization solutions of data into reports and graphics to illustrate facts, trends, and insights.</li><li>Develops solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.</li><li>Supports development and execution of strategic analytics &amp; reporting initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.</li><li>Analyzes data and information to provide subject-matter insights and recommendations.</li><li>Documents and maintain operational procedures and processes relating to analytical and reporting processes.</li><li>Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.</li><li>Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders in order to deliver on business objectives.</li><li>Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.</li><li>Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.</li><li>Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.</li><li>Job Qualifications *</li><li>Knowledge and experience in data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tool sets including but not limited to Spotfire, Tableau, SQL, SAS, R, Python, MATLAB, SPSS</li><li>Strong Excel skills are a must including Power Queries, VBA, and Pivot Tables</li><li>Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience - 4-6 years</li><li>Nice to Have: Python, PowerBI and Power Automate</li><li>Job Details*</li><li>Workplace: Hybrid 2-3 days in office in Chicago, Illinois</li><li>Placement: 6 month contract with the possibility to be extended</li><li>Estimated Start Date: July 1st, 2023</li></ul><p><br></p>About Aston Carter:<p><br></p>Please Note: Scammers are posing as Aston Carter. We'll never contact you via Gmail, Telegram, or WhatsApp and we'll never solicit money from you.<p><br></p>At Aston Carter, we’re dedicated to expanding career opportunities for the skilled professionals who power our business. Our success is driven by the talented, motivated people who join our team across a range of positions – from recruiting, sales and delivery to corporate roles. As part of our team, employees have the opportunity for long-term career success, where hard work is rewarded and the potential for growth is limitless. Established in 1997, Aston Carter is a leading staffing and consulting firm, providing high-caliber talent and premium services to more than 7,000 companies across North America. Spanning four continents and more than 200 offices, we extend our clients’ capabilities by seeking solvers and delivering solutions to address today’s workforce challenges. For organizations looking for innovative solutions shaped by critical-thinking professionals, visit [AstonCarter.com.](AstonCarter.com) Aston Carter is a company within Allegis Group, a global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law. If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to a disability, please call 888-237-6835 or email [astoncarteraccommodation@astoncarter.com](mailto:%20astoncarteraccommodation@astoncarter.com) for other accommodation options. However, if you have questions about this position, please contact the Recruiter located at the bottom of the job posting. The Recruiter is the sole point of contact for questions about this position.

title: Data Governance Analyst
description: This is your opportunity to join AXIS Capital – a trusted global provider of specialty lines insurance and reinsurance. We stand apart for our outstanding client service, intelligent risk taking and superior risk adjusted returns for our shareholders. We also proudly maintain an entrepreneurial, disciplined and ethical corporate culture. As a member of AXIS, you join a team that is among the best in the industry.<p><br></p>At AXIS, we believe that we are only as strong as our people. We strive to create an inclusive and welcoming culture where employees of all backgrounds and from all walks of life feel comfortable and empowered to be themselves. This means that we bring our whole selves to work.<p><br></p>All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion or creed, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, age, marital status, civil union status, family or parental status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Accommodation is available upon request for candidates taking part in the selection process.<p><br></p>Data Governance Analyst<p><br></p>Role Description<p><br></p>This role will be responsible for working with the data governance and data quality teams at AXIS to support the data governance objectives of the organization, including but not limited to defining requirements, managing projects, and coordinating with the business, IT, operations, and other departments to discuss, develop, and implement data solutions that ensure alignment with data governance standards and policies. The role may work with the IT department to set data requirements and ensure consistent presentation, consistent definition, accuracy, and accessibility of data throughout the data lifecycle.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Prototype, develop, maintain various data acquisition and retrieval flows. Requiring having an in-depth understanding of data systems, and how they relate to use of data by actuaries, finance, and other business users.</li><li> Work with the business and source data experts to ensure data is accurate and fit for purpose, consistently defined and consistently presented; develop and implement control processes as necessary to monitor data accuracy and quality.</li><li> Manage data governance projects related to data dictionaries, reference data management, data lineage, aligned with business priorities.</li><li> Work hands on as necessary to develop prototypes of solutions to validate the requirements and designs. Provide data-related requirements to segment IT and assist with UAT as needed to implement solutions in production environments.</li><li> Work closely with IT, Finance, and Operations to execute a change process that includes all data creators, managers, and users to ensure that data and analytical solutions meet needs across the Insurance and Reinsurance areas. Work with business intelligence resources to ensure that these solutions will also meet requirements for management information / business intelligence needs. Solutions need to balance both ad-hoc needs as well as longer term strategic development.</li><li> Utilize advanced excel functions, VBA, etc. to build solutions to data related issues. Including pulling and inserting data from SQL Server, building reports, etc.</li><li> Work with IT to ensure that data elements, logic, etc. aligns with the needs and expectations of the organization.</li><li> Assist in implementing data governance tools.</li><li> Communicate openly and often with other members of the Data &amp; Analytics team.<br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Required Skills And Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience</li><li> Prior experience delivering, managing, and defining data for analytics and business intelligence solutions</li><li> Experience in project management.</li><li> Experience with insurance concepts/terminology</li><li> Experience in / with:</li><li>SQL/T-SQL - SQL Server Management Studio, Access</li><li>VBA</li><li>Excel</li><li>Word</li><li>PowerPoint</li><li>SSIS, not required but experience is a plus</li><li>SharePoint, not required but experience is a plus<br></li></ul><p><br></p>Salary Range:<p><br></p>For this position, we currently expect to offer a base salary in the range of $60K to $75K. The specific salary offer will be based on an assessment of a variety of factors including the experience of the successful candidate and their work location.<p><br></p>In addition, all employees are eligible for competitive incentive targets, with awards based on overall corporate and individual performance. On top of this, we offer a comprehensive and competitive benefits package which includes medical plans for employees and their families, health and wellness programs, retirement plans, tuition reimbursement, paid vacation, and much more.

title: Data Research Analyst, gt.school (Remote) - $60,000/year USD
description: Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, gt.school. Have you got what it takes?<p><br></p>Are you ready to revolutionize education with the power of cutting-edge technology? We're seeking strategic problem solvers who thrive on developing and implementing innovative solutions and are eager to apply the power of generative AI to supercharge their work. Your consistent high performance and dedication will drive our mission to revolutionize education.<p><br></p>At gt.school, we're on a mission to accelerate the pace of learning by 5-10X, harnessing the incredible potential of technology, algorithms, and generative AI. We are creating a platform where students can discover, explore, and learn at an unprecedented rate. You'll play a pivotal role in bringing this vision to life. You'll have the opportunity to build new tools and operational processes, as well as streamline existing workflows for maximum efficiency.<p><br></p>But that's not all! At gt.school, we believe in your growth and development. You'll receive regular coaching and training from a team of global tech experts and operations professionals, ensuring your continuous improvement. We value collaboration and provide a supportive environment where you can meet with team members to work together on exciting projects.<p><br></p>If you're eager for a role that combines research, strategy, product development, and data science in the ever-evolving realm of education and technology, seize the moment and apply below. Let's embark on this exhilarating journey together!<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Engineering generative AI prompts in Python/JavaScript/JSON</li><li>Analyze AI outputs and iterate on prompts to reach desired outcomes</li><li>Leverage generative AI and technology to develop new educational tools, iterate on current products, and finetune AI training models</li><li>Research topics to support the product engineering team</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You Won’t Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collecting data or performing administrative tasks - we have a junior operations analyst team to do this type of work.</li><li>Working on unimportant projects - you'll be tasked with projects that are mission-critical</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Data Research Analyst Key Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>Create technical functionalities that revolutionize the way education is delivered.<p><br></p><strong><u>Basic Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent written and verbal English communication skills</li><li>Proficient in Python, R, JavaScript, or another OOP language</li><li>2+ years of work experience working in a technical field (science, technology, programming, financial services, data science, etc.)</li><li>Consistently able to work 40 hours per week, Monday through Friday, between 6AM and 6PM CST</li><li>Must be a proactive communicator who can effectively manage multiple priorities and stakeholders simultaneously</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Gt.school</u></strong><p><br></p>gt.school is a stealth EdTech startup in Austin, Texas, the center of educational innovation in the US. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and high-performance life skills coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn 5x faster and unlock their full potential in both academics and in life. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.<p><br></p>There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!<p><br></p><strong>Working with Crossover</strong><p><br></p>This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.<p><br></p><strong>What to expect next:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.</li><li>Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Important!</strong> If you do not receive an email from us:<p><br></p><ul><li>First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.</li><li>Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.</li><li>Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.</li><li>If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.</li></ul> Crossover Job Code: LJ-4880-US-Chicago-DataResearchAn.008<p><br></p>

title: Data Engineer
description: Hyatt Corporate Office, Chicago The Opportunity At Hyatt, we're working to Advance Care through data-driven decisions and automation. This mission serves as the foundation for every decision as we create the future of travel. We can't do that without the best talent - talent that is innovative, curious, and driven to create exceptional experiences for our guests, customers, owners, and colleagues. Hyatt seeks an experienced Data Engineer who will be an exceptional addition to our growing engineering team. The Data Engineer will work closely with engineering, product managers, and data science teams to meet the data requirements of various initiatives in Hyatt. As a Data Engineer, you will take on big data challenges in an agile way. In this role, you will build data pipelines that enable engineers, analysts, and other stakeholders across the organization. You will build data models to deliver insightful analytics while ensuring the highest standard of data integrity. You will integrate different data sources, improve the efficiency, reliability, and latency of our data system, help automate data pipelines, and improve our data model and overall architecture. You will be part of a highly visible, collaborative, and passionate data engineering team and will be working on all the aspects of design, development, and implementation of scalable and reliable data products and pipelines. Applying the latest techniques and approaches across the domains of data engineering, and machine learning engineering isn't just a nice to have, it's a must. This candidate builds fantastic relationships across all levels of the organization and is recognized as a problem solver who looks to elevate the work of everyone around them. You will be part of a team that is passionate about diversity, equity, and inclusion, committed to nurturing curiosity and new skills and building connections across the organization with stakeholders, colleagues, and guests. Who We Are At Hyatt, we believe in the power of belonging and creating a culture of care, where our colleagues become family. Since 1957, our colleagues and guests have been at the heart of our business and helped Hyatt become one of the world's best and fastest-growing hospitality brands. Our transformative growth and the addition of new hotels, brands, and business lines can open the door for exciting career and growth opportunities for our colleagues. As we continue to grow, we never lose sight of what's most important: People. We turn trips into journeys, encounters into experiences, and jobs into careers. Why Now? This is an exciting time to be at Hyatt. We are growing rapidly and are looking for passionate changemakers to be a part of our journey. The hospitality industry is resilient and continues to offer dynamic opportunities for upward mobility, and Hyatt is no exception. How We Care for Our People Our purpose sets us apart-to care for people so they can be their best. Every business decision is made through the lens of our purpose, and it informs how we have and will continue to support each other as members of the Hyatt family. Our care for our colleagues is the key to our success. We're proud to have earned a place on Fortune's prestigious 100 Best Companies to Work For® list for the last ten years. This recognition is a testament to the tremendous way our Hyatt family continues to come together to care for one another, our commitment to a culture of inclusivity, empathy, and respect, and making sure everyone feels like they belong. We're proud to offer exceptional corporate benefits which include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Annual allotment of free hotel stays at Hyatt hotels globally</li><li>Flexible work schedule and location</li><li>Work-life benefits including well-being initiatives such as a complimentary Headspace subscription, and a discount at the on-site fitness center</li><li>A global family assistance policy with paid time off following the birth or adoption of a child as well as financial assistance for adoption</li><li>Paid Time Off, Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K with company match Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Our success is underpinned by our diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and we are committed to diversity across the board-from whom we hire and develop, the organizations we support, and whom we buy from and work with. Being part of Hyatt means always having space to be you. Our global teams are a mosaic of cultures, ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities, and identities. We constantly strive to reflect the world we care for with teams that achieve and grow together. To learn more about our commitments to DE&amp;I, please visit the Why Hyatt section of the Hyatt career page. Who You Are As our ideal candidate, you understand the power and purpose of our Culture of Care and embody our core values of Empathy, Inclusion, Integrity, Experimentation, Respect, and Well-being. You enjoy working with others, are results-driven, and are looking for a variety of opportunities to develop personally and professionally. The Role</li><li>Collaborate with product managers, data scientists, engineering, and program management teams to define product features, business deliverables, and strategies for data products</li><li>Collaborate with business partners, operations, senior management, etc. on day-to-day operational support</li><li>Support operational reporting, self-service data engineering efforts, production data pipelines, and business intelligence suite</li><li>Interface with multiple diverse stakeholders and gather/understand business requirements, assess feasibility and impact, and deliver on time with high quality</li><li>Design appropriate solutions and recommend alternative approaches when necessary</li><li>Work with high volumes of data, fine-tuning database queries and able to solve complex technical problems</li><li>Contribute to multiple projects/demands simultaneously</li><li>Work in a fast-paced, collaborative, and iterative environment</li><li>Exercise independent judgment in methods and techniques for obtaining results</li><li>Work in an agile/scrum environment</li><li>Use state-of-the-art technologies to acquire, ingest and transform big datasetsQualificationsExperience Required:</li><li>2 to 5+ years of experience within the field of data engineering or related technical work including business intelligence, analytics</li><li>Experience and comfort in solving problems in an ambiguous environment where there is constant change. Have the tenacity to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, inspire change, and collaborate with a variety of individuals and organizational partners.</li><li>Experience designing and building scalable and robust data pipelines to enable data-driven decisions for the business</li><li>Very good understanding of the full software development life cycle</li><li>Very good understanding of Data warehousing concepts and approaches</li><li>Experience in building Data pipelines and ETL approaches</li><li>Experience in building Data warehouses and Business intelligence projects</li><li>Experience in data cleansing, data validation, and data wrangling</li><li>Hands-on experience in AWS cloud and AWS native technologies such as Glue, Lambda, Kinesis, Lake Formation, S3, Redshift</li><li>Experience using Spark EMR, RDS, EC2, Athena, API capabilities, CloudWatch, and CloudTrail is a plus</li><li>Experience with Business Intelligence tools like Tableau, Cognos, ThoughtSpot, etc. is a plus</li><li>Hands-on experience building complex business logic and ETL workflows using Informatica PowerCenter is preferred</li><li>Experience in one of the scripting languages: Python or Unix Scripting</li><li>Proficient in SQL, PL/SQL, relational databases (RDBMS), database concepts, and dimensional modeling</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Demonstrate integrity and maturity, and a constructive approach to challenges</li><li>Demonstrate analytical and problem-solving skills, particularly those that apply to Data Warehouse and Big Data environments</li><li>Open-minded, solution-oriented, and a very good team player</li><li>Passionate about programming and learning new technologies; focused on helping yourself and the team improve skills</li><li>Effective problem-solving and analytical skills.</li><li>Ability to manage multiple projects and report simultaneously across different stakeholders</li><li>Rigorous attention to detail and accuracy</li><li>Bachelor's degree in engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Finance, or a related quantitative field The position responsibilities outlined above are in no way to be construed as all-encompassing. Other duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may be required and/or assigned as necessary. We welcome you: Research shows that women, people of color, and other historically excluded groups, tend to apply to jobs, only if they meet all the listed job qualifications. Unsure if you check every box, but feeling inspired to enhance your career? Apply. We'd love to consider your unique experiences and how you could make Hyatt even better.PDN-994f7ec4-465b-4026-8856-aa477d3ae93e</li></ul>

Have the tenacity to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, inspire change, and collaborate with a variety of individuals and organizational partners.</li><li>Experience designing and building scalable and robust data pipelines to enable data-driven decisions for the business</li><li>Very good understanding of the full software development life cycle</li><li>Very good understanding of Data warehousing concepts and approaches</li><li>Experience in building Data pipelines and ETL approaches</li><li>Experience in building Data warehouses and Business intelligence projects</li><li>Experience in data cleansing, data validation, and data wrangling</li><li>Hands-on experience in AWS cloud and AWS native technologies such as Glue, Lambda, Kinesis, Lake Formation, S3, Redshift</li><li>Experience using Spark EMR, RDS, EC2, Athena, API capabilities, CloudWatch, and CloudTrail is a plus</li><li>Experience with Business Intelligence tools like Tableau, Cognos, ThoughtSpot, etc. is a plus</li><li>Hands-on experience building complex business logic and ETL workflows using Informatica PowerCenter is preferred</li><li>Experience in one of the scripting languages: Python or Unix Scripting</li><li>Proficient in SQL, PL/SQL, relational databases (RDBMS), database concepts, and dimensional modeling</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Demonstrate integrity and maturity, and a constructive approach to challenges</li><li>Demonstrate analytical and problem-solving skills, particularly those that apply to Data Warehouse and Big Data environments</li><li>Open-minded, solution-oriented, and a very good team player</li><li>Passionate about programming and learning new technologies; focused on helping yourself and the team improve skills</li><li>Effective problem-solving and analytical skills.</li><li>Ability to manage multiple projects and report simultaneously across different stakeholders</li><li>Rigorous attention to detail and accuracy</li><li>Bachelor's degree in engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Finance, or a related quantitative field The position responsibilities outlined above are in no way to be construed as all-encompassing. Other duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may be required and/or assigned as necessary. We welcome you: Research shows that women, people of color, and other historically excluded groups, tend to apply to jobs, only if they meet all the listed job qualifications. Unsure if you check every box, but feeling inspired to enhance your career? Apply. We'd love to consider your unique experiences and how you could make Hyatt even better.PDN-994f7ec4-465b-4026-8856-aa477d3ae93e</li></ul>

title: Director Data Analysis- Marketing
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Position Overview:</u></strong><p><br></p>The Director of Data Analysis- Marketing is responsible for leading an organization that performs analytics and provides intelligence and/or recommendations to solve business issues to business partners. With a team of 15+, the incumbent develops the strategy for intelligence and issue resolution utilizing analytics including both qualitative and quantitative methods. The successful candidate will have strong stakeholder, people management and analytics experience.<p><br></p>They will partner with technology teams to identify, develop, and implement analytical tools that empowers the organization to provide high quality business intelligence.<p><br></p>Creates a culture of effective risk management, accountability, and demonstration of risk awareness across the organization.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities: </u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Has excellent verbal and written communication skills. Demonstrates the value of analytical work through verbal communication, compelling presentations and data visualization suited to different levels of leadership.</li><li>Proactively identifies issues and problem solves them creatively. Demonstrates an ability to think strategically and outside the box while solving analytical problems or resolving issues.</li><li>Fosters a relationship of trust with stakeholders and proactively identifies opportunities to drive marketing strategy and support business growth.</li><li>Manages an analytics organization including hire/fire, performance reviews, assignment of work, and development decisions.</li><li>Has proven experience influencing business partners and senior leadership with strong analytics support and data driven solutions.</li><li>Understands P&amp;L dynamics, has in-depth experience with test designs and ability to translate test results into action. </li><li>Leads a team of experienced analysts to drive complex analytical solutions and data driven insights. Provides guidance to the team that aligns analytic activities with business goals.</li><li>Partners with technology teams to identify, develop, and implement core analytical tools and capabilities.</li><li>Develops and implements the organizational strategy for issue resolution utilizing analytics including both qualitative and quantitative methods.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor in Analytics, Information Technology, Economics or Engineering</li><li>8+ years of experience in Analytics, Modeling, Insights or Related</li></ul><p><br></p><u><strong>In Lieu of Education</strong></u><p><br></p><ul><li>10+ years of experience in Analytics, Modeling, Insights or related minimum</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>If we had our say, we’d also look for:<p><br></p><ul><li>Master in Analytics, Information Technology, Economics or Engineering preferred</li><li>10+ years of experience in Analytics, Modeling, Insights or related preferred</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $147,000.00 to $223,400.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Developer Associate
description: <strong>Department: </strong>IT AS ADO Peoplesoft<p><br></p><strong>Salary/Grade: </strong>ITS/78<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>Completes maintenance on existing software products. Assists in developing code, test, and debugs new software, and makes enhancements to existing software. Writes programs according to specifications from senior staff. Performs basic system integration tasks.<p><br></p><strong><u>Specific Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><em> Strategic Planning </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Collaborates with user to develop workflow and best practices. </li><li> Assists in all stages of the project, starting from the initial planning stages. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Administration </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Responds to inquiries via phone, online, in-person, etc. </li><li> Creates and maintains software/process/support documentation. </li><li> Routes more complex requests for features/upgrades/changes to appropriate senior staff/management. </li><li> Participates in team/project meetings. </li><li> Identifies database and software performance issues and make adjustments. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Development </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Assists with design, development, and maintenance. </li><li> Tests and debugs software. </li><li> Writes programs according to specifications from senior staff. </li><li> Codes software applications adhering to designs that support internal business requirements or external user. </li><li> Completes tier 3 troubleshooting. </li><li> Develops reports. </li><li> Prioritizes assigned tasks. </li><li> Opens help tickets with vendors. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Miscellaneous </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Performs other duties as assigned. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications</u></strong>     <ul><li> Successful completion of a full 4-year course of study in an accredited college or university leading to a bachelor's or higher degree in a major such as computer science, information technology, or related; OR appropriate combination of education and experience. </li><li> No experience required. </li><li> Please see information highlighted below.</li><ul><li> Infrastructure</li><ul><li> Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Access, Outlook) </li><li> Microsoft SharePoint </li><li> Oracle database </li><li> SQL </li></ul><li> Programming Languages and Frameworks</li><ul><li> HTML 5 </li><li> JavaScript </li><li> Python </li></ul><li> Analytical</li><ul><li> Critical thinking </li><li> Debugging </li><li> Decision making </li><li> Judgment </li><li> Problem solving </li><li> Troubleshooting </li><li> Use-case analysis </li></ul><li> Project</li><ul><li> Agile environment </li><li> Code documentation </li><li> Collaboration and teamwork </li><li> Iterative &amp; incremental development </li><li> Organizational skills </li></ul></ul></ul><p><br></p><strong> Minimum Competencies: (Skills, knowledge, and abilities.) </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Solid written and verbal communication. </li><li> Problem solving and critical thinking skills. </li><li> Team collaboration </li><li> Coding experience or coding boot camp </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field. </li><li> 1-2 years programming experience in real world setting. </li><li> 1-3 years People (PeopleCode, PeopleTools) </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Preferred Competencies: (Skills, knowledge, and abilities) </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> SQL </li><li> Debugging and troubleshooting skills. </li><li> Agile scrum team collaboration </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>At Northwestern, we are proud to provide meaningful, competitive, high-quality health care plans, retirement benefits, tuition discounts and more! Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/benefits/index.html to learn more.<p><br></p><strong><u>Work-Life And Wellness</u></strong><p><br></p>Northwestern offers comprehensive programs and services to help you and your family navigate life’s challenges and opportunities, and adopt and maintain healthy lifestyles.<p><br></p>We support flexible work arrangements where possible and programs to help you locate and pay for quality, affordable childcare and senior/adult care. Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/benefits/work-life/index.html to learn more. <strong> <strong> Professional Growth &amp; Development: <br><br></strong>Northwestern supports employee career development in all circumstances whether your workspace is on campus or at home. If you’re interested in developing your professional potential or continuing your formal education, we offer a variety of tools and resources. Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/learning/index.html to learn more. <br><br></strong>Northwestern strongly recommends COVID-19 vaccinations and boosters for people who can obtain them as a critical tool for minimizing severe illness. More information can be found on the COVID-19 and Campus Updates webpage.<br><br><em>The Northwestern campus sits on the traditional homelands of the people of the Council of Three Fires, the Ojibwe, Potawatomi, and Odawa as well as the Menominee, Miami and Ho-Chunk nations. We acknowledge and honor the original people of the land upon which Northwestern University stands, and the Native people who remain on this land today.<br><br></em><em>Northwestern University is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer of all protected classes, including veterans and individuals with disabilities. Women, racial and ethnic minorities, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are encouraged to apply. Click for information on EEO is the Law.</em>

title: Data Engineer
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Motion Recruitment, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p>We are looking for a Data Engineer to join a Logistics company with an office in Naperville. This is a dynamic and innovative company at the forefront of revolutionizing the transportation industry by partnering with 5-star carriers and security/law enforcement to ensure timely delivery for high-priority cargo.<p><br></p>In this role you'll be focusing on building ETL solutions, web apps using Python/Django, and deploying with Azure cloud. Required Skills &amp; Experience<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.</li><li>Proven experience as a Data Engineer, with a focus on data modeling, ETL processes, and data integration.</li><li>Strong programming skills in Python and experience with Django framework.</li><li>Proficiency in cloud platforms, particularly Microsoft Azure, and familiarity with Azure data services.</li><li>Hands-on experience with Snaplogic or similar data integration tools.</li></ul> Desired Skills &amp; Experience<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience in the logistics or supply chain industry is a plus.</li><li>Knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) is advantageous.</li><li>Familiarity with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) is a bonus.</li><li>Familiarity with Machine Learning is a bonus</li></ul> The Offer<p><br></p><ul><li>Bonus OR Commission eligible</li></ul> You will receive the following benefits:<p><br></p><ul><li>Medical Insurance </li><li>Dental Benefits</li><li>Vision Benefits</li><li>Paid Time Off (PTO)</li><li>401(k) {including match- if applicable}</li></ul><p><br></p>Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis now and in the future.

title: Cloud Data Engineer
description: <strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Your Job</strong><p><br></p>The Koch Cyber Security Team is seeking a Security Data Engineer to join our global cyber security team. As a member of this team your primary duties will be to attend to the health and support of our SIEM tool and work closely with our analyst to ensure that data is available to them when needed.<p><br></p><strong>Our Team</strong><p><br></p>The Koch Cyber Security team is a dynamic and proactive force, fueled by an unwavering commitment to Koch's vision for value creation. With a relentless drive, we tackle cyber threats head-on, always ready to protect our stakeholders from any potential harm. Our team members are trailblazers, spearheading transformational efforts in areas such as Incident Response, Automation, exposure management, awareness, and the ever-evolving cyber landscape. We thrive on challenges and constantly seek innovative solutions to safeguard our organization and its interests.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Do</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Oversee the ingestion and normalization of new data sources. </li><li>Maintain data availability</li><li>Detect and remediate any drop in data ingestion</li><li>Support, maintain and improve infrastructure for the data collection tools overall health</li><li>Respond to customer inquiries surrounding the collection of data</li><li>Work closely with Cyber Security team to ensure that analyst have access to the data they need and that it’s presented in a clear and concise manner</li><li>Stay up to date with the latest trends and technologies in data engineering and cloud infrastructure management and applying them to our data collection tool stack</li><li>Actively seek ways to improve our current data collection tool stack.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Who You Are (Basic Qualifications)</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience supporting a SIEM tool at a global enterprise level</li><li>Experience deploying Infrastructure in cloud environments</li><li>Experience building and troubleshooting data pipelines.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What Will Put You Ahead</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with Global Information\Cyber Security Teams</li><li>Experience with Machine Learning </li><li>Experience with Multiple Operating Systems</li><li>Knowledge with PowerShell, JavaScript, or Python Scripting</li><li>Windows Or Linux Administration Experience</li><li>SOAR Platform Experience</li><li>Familiar with CIM date compliance</li></ul><p><br></p><em>At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. This means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. Any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. The actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. If you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy.</em><p><br></p><strong>Hiring Philosophy </strong><p><br></p>All Koch companies value diversity of thought, perspectives, aptitudes, experiences, and backgrounds. We are Military Ready and Second Chance employers. Learn more about our hiring philosophy here.<p><br></p><strong><u>Who We Are</u></strong><p><br></p>As a Koch company, Koch Global Services (KGS) creates solutions spanning technology, human resources, finance, project management and anything else our businesses need. With locations in India, Mexico, Poland and the United States, our employees have the opportunity to make a global impact.<p><br></p>At Koch, employees are empowered to do what they do best to make life better. Learn how our business philosophy helps employees unleash their potential while creating value for themselves and the company.<p><br></p><strong><u>Our Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>Our goal is for each employee, and their families, to live fulfilling and healthy lives. We provide essential resources and support to build and maintain physical, financial, and emotional strength focusing on overall wellbeing so you can focus on what matters most. Our benefits plan includes medical, dental, vision, flexible spending and health savings accounts, life insurance, ADD, disability, retirement, paid vacation/time off, educational assistance, and may also include infertility assistance, paid parental leave and adoption assistance. Specific eligibility criteria is set by the applicable Summary Plan Description, policy or guideline and benefits may vary by geographic region. If you have questions on what benefits apply to you, please speak to your recruiter.<p><br></p><strong>Equal Opportunities </strong><p><br></p>Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and protected veteran status. Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test. This employer uses E-Verify. Please visit the following website for additional information: http://www.kochcareers.com/doc/Everify.pdf
description_json: <strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Your Job</strong><p><br></p>The Koch Cyber Security Team is seeking a Security Data Engineer to join our global cyber security team. As a member of this team your primary duties will be to attend to the health and support of our SIEM tool and work closely with our analyst to ensure that data is available to them when needed.<p><br></p><strong>Our Team</strong><p><br></p>The Koch Cyber Security team is a dynamic and proactive force, fueled by an unwavering commitment to Koch's vision for value creation. With a relentless drive, we tackle cyber threats head-on, always ready to protect our stakeholders from any potential harm. Our team members are trailblazers, spearheading transformational efforts in areas such as Incident Response, Automation, exposure management, awareness, and the ever-evolving cyber landscape. We thrive on challenges and constantly seek innovative solutions to safeguard our organization and its interests.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Do</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Oversee the ingestion and normalization of new data sources. </li><li>Maintain data availability</li><li>Detect and remediate any drop in data ingestion</li><li>Support, maintain and improve infrastructure for the data collection tools overall health</li><li>Respond to customer inquiries surrounding the collection of data</li><li>Work closely with Cyber Security team to ensure that analyst have access to the data they need and that it’s presented in a clear and concise manner</li><li>Stay up to date with the latest trends and technologies in data engineering and cloud infrastructure management and applying them to our data collection tool stack</li><li>Actively seek ways to improve our current data collection tool stack.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Who You Are (Basic Qualifications)</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience supporting a SIEM tool at a global enterprise level</li><li>Experience deploying Infrastructure in cloud environments</li><li>Experience building and troubleshooting data pipelines.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What Will Put You Ahead</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with Global Information\Cyber Security Teams</li><li>Experience with Machine Learning </li><li>Experience with Multiple Operating Systems</li><li>Knowledge with PowerShell, JavaScript, or Python Scripting</li><li>Windows Or Linux Administration Experience</li><li>SOAR Platform Experience</li><li>Familiar with CIM date compliance</li></ul><p><br></p><em>At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. This means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. Any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. The actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. If you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy.</em><p><br></p><strong>Hiring Philosophy </strong><p><br></p>All Koch companies value diversity of thought, perspectives, aptitudes, experiences, and backgrounds. We are Military Ready and Second Chance employers. Learn more about our hiring philosophy here.<p><br></p><strong><u>Who We Are</u></strong><p><br></p>As a Koch company, Koch Global Services (KGS) creates solutions spanning technology, human resources, finance, project management and anything else our businesses need. Specific eligibility criteria is set by the applicable Summary Plan Description, policy or guideline and benefits may vary by geographic region. title: Security Data Engineer
description: We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.<p><br></p>At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.<p><br></p>To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>Overview:<p><br></p>This role requires extensive familiarity with Windows, Linux servers and frequently involves user support tasks. Expertise with the Windows operating system and server administration to develop and deploy servers, support day-to-day system performance, and prevent data loss and unauthorized access is required. This role encompasses back-end IT support for business-critical and development-related departments and personnel.<p><br></p>Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Administer and support core Microsoft, Linux, VMware technologies and Azure resources</li><li>Install and Configure Windows Servers and Linux Server.</li><li>Develop servers and provide support to individual users to ensure that the system works reliably and quickly.</li><li>Manage server virtualization technologies like VMWare Server/ESX</li><li>Responsible for implementing, monitoring, and maintaining the instances of the on-prem and cloud infrastructure services and the servers.</li><li>Knowledge in Application Insights, service principal in Azure, NSG rule, Azure Key vault </li><li>Provide technical support and guidance to users and other administrators.</li><li>Works closely with other IT departments and vendors to answer technical questions or resolve issues with server performance and access.</li><li>Install and maintain Windows-based programs for end users and help debug applications so that they work with Windows servers.</li><li>Perform System Maintenance activities like review backups, error logs and user-reported errors and identify stable and reliable solutions.</li><li>Monitor performance to reduce interruptions and server crashes. Develop and deploy proactive solutions and setup alerts to ensure system usability across the organization.</li><li>Maintain system security by noticing faults and vulnerabilities within the server’s architecture.</li><li>Provides troubleshooting and support, including on-call rotation, after-hours support</li><li>Other duties as assigned.</li></ul><p><br></p>Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>Windows/Linux administration</li><li>Azure Certification is preferred</li><li>Experience with Azure</li><li>Good knowledge of the Windows servers ( 2012 R2, 2016, 2019)</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills and ability to apply these skills to identify and resolve anomalies in system functionality and performance</li><li>Managing server virtualization technologies like VMWare Server/ESX</li><li>Group Policy design, configuration Active Directory/LDAP user and group administration</li><li>Strong communication and documentation skills</li><li>Flexible and able to adapt to a rapidly changing environment and can manage projects of varying length</li><li>Responsible, highly reliable, organized; able to work individually and collaboratively with peers</li><li>Windows system administration: 8+ years</li><li>2 years Azure experience.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Risk &amp; Compliance:</strong><p><br></p>Our CIBC risk culture is based on employees striving to exceed the expectations of ourselves and our leadership’s identification and mitigation of risks in their daily responsibilities, not just in quarterly or annual monitoring/assessments. We all are accountable for managing risk.<p><br></p>As an employee of CIBC the incumbent must conduct themselves (and foster an environment for others) in a manner consistent with our strong risk culture. This includes:<p><br></p><ul><li>Following all aspects of the CIBC Code of Conduct, as well as all applicable CIBC policies, frameworks, guidelines, processes and controls</li><li>At all times acting in accordance with our Purpose and shared values, to achieve our Bank’s strategic goals</li><li>Understanding and following the qualitative and quantitative components of our Risk Appetite Statements</li><li>Completing all annual Corporate Mandatory Training and Testing modules, as well as any additional business-specific modules, as required and employing the learnings in daily activities and undertakings</li><li>Escalating matters through one of the appropriate channels identified in the CIBC Code of Conduct (i.e., HR, management, Ethics Hotline, Whistleblower, etc.) upon observing activities that may be inconsistent with CIBC’s policies, frameworks, guidelines, processes and controls</li><li>Speaking up if witnessing behaviors that drive poor or unfair outcomes for clients, team members or other stakeholders</li><li>Escalating matters that can result in adverse market practices and outcomes, thereby negatively impacting CIBC’s reputation as a leading financial institution</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You Need To Know</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com</li><li>You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Location</strong><p><br></p>IL-70 W Madison St, 8th Fl<p><br></p><strong>Employment Type</strong><p><br></p>Regular<p><br></p><strong>Weekly Hours</strong><p><br></p>40<p><br></p><strong>Skills</strong><p><br></p>Group Policy, Microsoft Azure Administration, Server Administration, VMware ESXi, VMware Server, Windows System Administration

title: Systems Engineer
description: Salary: Starting at $180k + bonus<p><br></p>Location: Hybrid role in either location<p><br></p>Chicago, IL/Dallas, TX<p><br></p>*We are unable to provide sponsorship for this role*<p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>B.S. in Computer Science or (preferred) M.S. in Computer Science or Information Systems</li><li>Minimum 10+ years of experience in Compute (Linux/Windows) administration</li><li>Minimum 5 years leading projects</li><li>Experience in a regulated/financial industry</li><li>Experience in Linux and Windows OS</li><li>Experience with VMWARE</li><li>Experience with EMC and Netapp Storage</li><li>Programming/Scripting experience in languages like Java, Bash, Python</li><li>Knowledge of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools (examples - GitHub, Jenkins, Artifactory, Docker, Compose, K8s)</li><li>Experience with cloud technologies and migrations</li><li>Working knowledge of DevOps tools. eg, Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins, Kubernetes, and CI/CD pipeline etc.</li><li>Experience preferred with AWS foundational services like VPCs, Security groups, EC2, S3, KMS, AWS CLI and IAM etc.</li><li>Experience developing and delivering technical solutions using On-prem infrastructure and public cloud service providers like Amazon, Google, etc.</li><li>Familiarity with monitoring related tools and frameworks like Splunk</li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs and JSON RPC</li><li>Experience following Git workflows</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Take ownership of the DevOps discipline and be responsible for managing all Level 2 server/infrastructure related issues in AWS.</li><li>Responsible for monitoring server and storage performance in On-prem and AWS</li><li>Responsible for CI/CD pipeline build, improvement, and management</li><li>Support and troubleshoot infrastructure issues in production environments.</li><li>Evaluate new tools, technologies, and processes to improve speed, efficiency, and scalability of continuous integration environments.</li></ul>

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong><strong>The opportunity:<br><br></strong>Achieve is looking for a talented Associate Test Engineer. We are a full-stack Test Engineering team that creates high-impact and low-drag activities in our pursuit of quality and productivity. As part of the Test Engineering team, you will work on the latest and greatest tools and technologies while meeting or exceeding team software quality standards. Mentored by our senior/staff test engineers, you will contribute to our technology roadmap. You'll have an opportunity to interact with every facet of our business.<br><br><strong><u>What You’ll Do<br></u></strong><ul><li>Work on an agile team collaborating with product owners, business analysts, and developers.</li><li>Provide feedback on features and record bugs.</li><li>Create and execute test cases and test automation.</li><li>Support the deployment of high-quality releases.</li><li>Work on latest frontend and backend test automation frameworks like WebdriverIO and UniRest<br></li></ul><strong><u>What You’ll Bring<br></u></strong><ul><li>1-3 years of experience in Software Test/QA role.</li><li>Hands-on programming experience in JavaScript, Node.js, Java.</li><li>Hands on test automation experience in UI or API. </li><li>Preferred - Test automation knowledge specifically on WebdriverIO and UniRest.</li><li>Quick learner and team player.</li><li>Comfortable with a fast paced environment.</li><li>Attention to detail.</li><li>Passion to learn new technologies.</li><li>Strong interest in pursuing a career in test engineering.<br></li></ul>

title: Associate Test Engineer
description: <strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Katten is a full-service law firm with approximately 700 attorneys in locations across the United States and in London and Shanghai. Clients seeking sophisticated, high-value legal services turn to Katten for counsel locally, nationally and internationally. The firm’s core areas of practice include corporate, financial markets and funds, insolvency and restructuring, intellectual property, litigation, real estate, structured finance and securitization, transactional tax planning, private credit and private wealth. Katten represents public and private companies in numerous industries, as well as a number of government and nonprofit organizations and individuals.<p><br></p><strong>Applications Engineer</strong><p><br></p>The Applications Engineer position's primary responsibility is to provide 3rd level support for firm and legal applications such as iManage Cloud, Microsoft 365, various Office-integrated applications, Microsoft Teams, commercial cloud applications such as HighQ, and various legal vertical applications used in our practice groups (e.g. tax, litigation) and operational departments (e.g. marketing, finance).<p><br></p>The Applications Engineer is also responsible for performing project work from inception to completion and providing support to Level I and/or Level II help desk by performing essential duties personally or in conjunction with other members of the IT Department.Maintains professionalism and strict confidentiality in all client and firm matters.<p><br></p><strong>The Applications Engineer position can be located in either the Chicago, New York, Los Angeles, Dallas, Charlotte or Washington D.C. office.</strong> Katten offers a hybrid work model, allowing the flexibility to work both on-site and remotely on a regular basis (KattenFlex).<p><br></p><strong>Essential Duties and Responsibilities</strong> include, but may not be limited to, the following. Other duties may be requested and/or assigned. Essential functions are primary job duties that an individual must be able to perform successfully with or without a reasonable accommodation. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.<p><br></p><ul><li> Provide support for Windows-based applications on a standardized Windows desktop platform. </li><li> Provide support for various cloud-based applications, including configuration and integration with on-premise systems. </li><li> Maintain existing applications. </li><li> Interact with attorneys, clients and vendors to resolve problems. </li><li> Coordinate with team members to maintain current desktop standards. </li><li> Provide technical support for a variety of on premise and cloud based applications including, but not limited to, Microsoft Windows, Microsoft 365, iManage Cloud, Microsoft Teams, Office-integrated products, InterAction, commercial cloud based applications, and various legal practice and operational applications. </li><li> Track and document support activities and assets using the help desk call tracking system. </li><li> Provide help desk with technical assistance by responding to inquiries regarding errors, problems or questions about programs. </li><li> Install and test programs, adhering to security guidelines set forth by security team. </li><li> Work with trainers to provide guidelines for training materials. </li><li> Occasional after-hours support is required. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Knowledge, Skills And Abilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Information Technology or related specialty and five or more years related experience preferred; or equivalent combination of education and experience. </li><li> Strong working knowledge of M365, SCCM, VMWare View and iManage is required.Administrative experience with iManage or M365 is a plus. Experience using SQL to query and extract/import data is a plus. Must be quality and results oriented. </li><li> Experience working in a law firm supporting software used to meet legal practice requirements is a strong plus.Previous software applications experience within a larger organization is preferred. </li><li> Proactive with the ability to identify, define, and analyze complex applications’ issues and problems and to recommend and implement solutions. </li><li> Exhibit high degree of initiative in exercising independent judgment with demonstrated troubleshooting, follow-through, and critical-thinking skills in order to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced, detail-oriented and consistently changing work environment with the ability to make decisions based upon results of research. </li><li> Excellent analytical and technical skills requiring an aptitude for detail, precision, and logic with comprehensive knowledge of Windows-based, client-server applications in order to conduct detailed analysis of applications’ project work including testing and installation. </li><li> Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills with the ability to communicate with courtesy and diplomacy and efficiently follow written and verbal instructions. </li><li> Ability to provide technical support and training to a diverse group of users having different levels of computer expertise including attorneys, support staff and clients.In addition, maintain effective relationships with vendors and consultants. </li><li> Excellent organizational skills including record keeping, data collection and system information.Ability to compile and analyze data and furnish information in report format, written correspondence, e‑mail or verbally. </li><li> Work routinely requires more than 37.5 hours (35 hours in New York) per week to perform the essential duties of the position because after-hours support is required. </li></ul><p><br></p>We offer an outstanding benefit package which includes: medical/dental/vision, 401k with employer contribution, parental leave, transportation fringe benefit program, back-up care option, generous paid time off policy, and long-term and short-term disability policies.<p><br></p>Katten Muchin Rosenman LLP is an Equal Opportunity Employer/AA-M/F/SO/Disability/Veteran.
