Katten represents public and private companies in numerous industries, as well as a number of government and nonprofit organizations and individuals.<p><br></p><strong>Applications Engineer</strong><p><br></p>The Applications Engineer position's primary responsibility is to provide 3rd level support for firm and legal applications such as iManage Cloud, Microsoft 365, various Office-integrated applications, Microsoft Teams, commercial cloud applications such as HighQ, and various legal vertical applications used in our practice groups (e.g. tax, litigation) and operational departments (e.g. marketing, finance).<p><br></p>The Applications Engineer is also responsible for performing project work from inception to completion and providing support to Level I and/or Level II help desk by performing essential duties personally or in conjunction with other members of the IT Department.Maintains professionalism and strict confidentiality in all client and firm matters.<p><br></p><strong>The Applications Engineer position can be located in either the Chicago, New York, Los Angeles, Dallas, Charlotte or Washington D.C. office.</strong> Katten offers a hybrid work model, allowing the flexibility to work both on-site and remotely on a regular basis (KattenFlex).<p><br></p><strong>Essential Duties and Responsibilities</strong> include, but may not be limited to, the following. Other duties may be requested and/or assigned. Essential functions are primary job duties that an individual must be able to perform successfully with or without a reasonable accommodation. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.<p><br></p><ul><li> Provide support for Windows-based applications on a standardized Windows desktop platform. </li><li> Provide support for various cloud-based applications, including configuration and integration with on-premise systems. </li><li> Maintain existing applications. </li><li> Interact with attorneys, clients and vendors to resolve problems. </li><li> Coordinate with team members to maintain current desktop standards. </li><li> Provide technical support for a variety of on premise and cloud based applications including, but not limited to, Microsoft Windows, Microsoft 365, iManage Cloud, Microsoft Teams, Office-integrated products, InterAction, commercial cloud based applications, and various legal practice and operational applications. </li><li> Track and document support activities and assets using the help desk call tracking system. </li><li> Provide help desk with technical assistance by responding to inquiries regarding errors, problems or questions about programs. </li><li> Install and test programs, adhering to security guidelines set forth by security team. </li><li> Work with trainers to provide guidelines for training materials. </li><li> Occasional after-hours support is required. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Knowledge, Skills And Abilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Information Technology or related specialty and five or more years related experience preferred; or equivalent combination of education and experience. </li><li> Strong working knowledge of M365, SCCM, VMWare View and iManage is required.Administrative experience with iManage or M365 is a plus. Experience using SQL to query and extract/import data is a plus. Must be quality and results oriented. </li><li> Experience working in a law firm supporting software used to meet legal practice requirements is a strong plus.Previous software applications experience within a larger organization is preferred. </li><li> Proactive with the ability to identify, define, and analyze complex applications’ issues and problems and to recommend and implement solutions. </li><li> Exhibit high degree of initiative in exercising independent judgment with demonstrated troubleshooting, follow-through, and critical-thinking skills in order to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced, detail-oriented and consistently changing work environment with the ability to make decisions based upon results of research. </li><li> Excellent analytical and technical skills requiring an aptitude for detail, precision, and logic with comprehensive knowledge of Windows-based, client-server applications in order to conduct detailed analysis of applications’ project work including testing and installation. </li><li> Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills with the ability to communicate with courtesy and diplomacy and efficiently follow written and verbal instructions. </li><li> Ability to provide technical support and training to a diverse group of users having different levels of computer expertise including attorneys, support staff and clients.In addition, maintain effective relationships with vendors and consultants. </li><li> Excellent organizational skills including record keeping, data collection and system information.Ability to compile and analyze data and furnish information in report format, written correspondence, e‑mail or verbally. </li><li> Work routinely requires more than 37.5 hours (35 hours in New York) per week to perform the essential duties of the position because after-hours support is required. </li></ul><p><br></p>We offer an outstanding benefit package which includes: medical/dental/vision, 401k with employer contribution, parental leave, transportation fringe benefit program, back-up care option, generous paid time off policy, and long-term and short-term disability policies.<p><br></p>Katten Muchin Rosenman LLP is an Equal Opportunity Employer/AA-M/F/SO/Disability/Veteran.

title: Applications Engineer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork, and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer (Monitoring Engineer) works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Previous administration experience in monitoring/event management tools such as: Datadog, Moogsoft, Netscout</li><li>Previous administration experience in workload management tools such as Autosys</li><li>1+ Years – Linux and SQL</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p>The scope of the Infrastructure Engineer role includes building, managing, and supporting core infrastructure and security services in public cloud to deliver highly available and scalable services, and meet security and compliance objectives. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining complex workflows using Unica software. You will support Infrastructure maintenance activities - Patching, Decomm, Filesystems and other infra related activity including the application upgrade and the performance of the application.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities</li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work</li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms</li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability</li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events</li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities</li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices</li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies</li><li>Collaborates with business partners to design, build and code cross-channel communications using campaign platforms such as Unica Campaign.</li><li>Responsible for administration of UNICA Campaign and UNICA Marketing Operations</li><li>This will also include providing UNICA platform security management, application and underlying infrastructure support (OS, Storage, Application, Web and Database).</li><li>Translates and conveys business solutions and strategies into system and database architecture.</li><li>Designs and builds strategies, processes, and technology solutions that support business needs and align with industry best practices.</li><li>Ability to create and translate complex SQL queries to support ad-hoc business requests.</li><li>Identifies data solutions to support complex campaigns including SQL Server, Oracle, Teradata, flat files, and data warehouses.</li><li>Develops and maintains best practices and standard operating procedures for campaigns.</li><li>Serves as the primary liaison to technology partners for issue escalation, and resolution.</li><li>Troubleshooting technical issues and providing technical support to Business partners</li><li>Maintaining and updating the workflow automation environment to ensure optimization.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related</li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related</li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>SQL competency, Linux Command Line competency</li><li>System Architecture experience</li><li>Experience working with Unica Campaign Management platforms.</li><li>UNICA campaign management product expertise – Administrative</li><li>Unica flowcharts experience</li><li>Experience with ETL Tools (Ab Initio, Data Stage, Informatica)</li><li>Experience in programming languages (Unix scripting, Python, Java, etc…)</li><li>Proficient in UNIX, and Linux</li><li>Proficiency in Scripting (Batch/Shell/Java Script).</li><li>Linux korn shell scripting knowledge </li><li>Websphere knowledge </li><li>SSH, SAS experience, SFTP competency</li><li>Experienced in other technology tools and stacks such as CI/CD, Jenkins, GitHub, Spark, and Open Source</li><li>Experience with scheduling tools: Autosys , Maestro</li><li>Experience working in cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) </li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong>Our Story </strong><p><br></p>Founded in 2008, Hightower is a wealth management firm that provides investment, financial and retirement planning services to individuals, foundations and family offices, as well as 401(k) consulting and cash management services to corporations. Hightower’s capital solutions, operational support services, size and scale empower its vibrant community of independent-minded wealth advisors to grow their businesses and help their clients achieve their vision of “well-th. rebalanced.” Based in Chicago with advisors across the U.S., we operate as a registered investment advisor (RIA).<p><br></p>Our commitment to our culture is demonstrated every day through the Hightower Way. By joining Hightower, you will build a community of inclusive relationships, take proactive ownership, embrace others’ perspectives, and have an uncompromising dedication to excellence.<p><br></p><strong> Your Future Team</strong><p><br></p>The Hightower Platform and Innovation group is growing and looking to add an Email Security Engineer, to work directly within the Technology Infrastructure team. This team is responsible for the firms; local/cloud, network, and unified communications infrastructure.<p><br></p><strong>What You’ll Do</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Serve as a Hightower brand ambassador by upholding The Hightower Way cultural elements – Mission, Purpose, V.A.L.U.E. Experience, Commitment and Standards, promoting excellence in the internal and external client experience during every encounter </li><li> Improve consistency in every client and colleague encounter by embodying the core principles of our Hightower V.A.L.U.E. Experience (Validate, Actively Listen, Leverage Resources, Understand Ownership, Express Gratitude) </li><li> Partner with cross-discipline team members to support collaboration and promote a positive client experience </li><li> Domain and Certificate management, &gt; 120 and growing domains </li><li> Act as the contact for resolving Email Security System operational tickets ensuring resolution as per defined SLAs </li><li> Monitor email traffic and respond to security alerts </li><li> Troubleshoot issues related to non-delivery of email related arising from Data Loss Prevention, intrusion and threat prevention </li><li> Ensure the Email security platform is configured and updated with heightened Cyber Security features and rules </li><li> Create Standard Operating Procedures and other similar documentation </li><li> Help implement counter-measures or mitigating control for email security issues <br><br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You’ll Bring</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Minimum 3 years of IT/email security experience in enterprise environments </li><li> Minimum 3 years of experience working with email threat prevention platforms in complex email delivery systems </li><li> In-depth knowledge of DNS, SMTP, DMARC, DKIM, and SPF </li><li> In-depth knowledge of Microsoft 365 online email and Secure Email Gateway such as Proofpoint Security Platform </li><li> In-depth knowledge of message archiving and compliance management </li><li> Proficient in the use of automation tools, configuration management solutions, DevOps principles, and data analytics </li><li> Working experience integrating SaaS services and APIs </li><li> Familiarity with the CI/CD process </li><li> Experience with Cloud architecture </li><li> Familiarity with Azure; Platform, AD, Graph API </li><li> Familiarity with scripting and using scripting languages (Python, Powershell) </li><li> Security and cloud certifications (CISSP, CCSP, AWS, Azure) <br><br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We Offer</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Coverage on the first day of employment for Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance </li><li> Paid Parental Leave (16 weeks for primary caregiver and 8 weeks for secondary caregiver) </li><li> Flexible PTO Plan </li><li> Hybrid Model Work Schedule (50% in office) </li><li> 401k Matching Plan </li><li> HSA Employer Contributions </li><li> Student Loan Assistance </li><li> Pet Insurance </li><li> We commit to a transparent, people-first environment where talent is maximized through our diverse, equitable and inclusive community </li><li> We nurture a spirit of belonging, are energized by challenges, celebrate our successes, and achieve individual and collective well-th goals <br><br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong> AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER: </strong> Hightower is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based upon race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, national origin, citizenship, veteran status, ancestry, age (over 40), physical or mental disability, medical condition (cancer-related), gender identity or expression, genetic information including sickle cell or hemoglobin C trait, or any other consideration made unlawful by applicable federal, state, or local law.<p><br></p>You are a U.S. citizen, U.S. permanent resident or possess other unrestricted U.S. work authorization and will not require sponsorship for U.S. work authorization now or anytime in the future.<p><br></p>Apply Now
description_json: <strong>Our Story </strong><p><br></p>Founded in 2008, Hightower is a wealth management firm that provides investment, financial and retirement planning services to individuals, foundations and family offices, as well as 401(k) consulting and cash management services to corporations. Hightower’s capital solutions, operational support services, size and scale empower its vibrant community of independent-minded wealth advisors to grow their businesses and help their clients achieve their vision of “well-th. rebalanced.” Based in Chicago with advisors across the U.S., we operate as a registered investment advisor (RIA).<p><br></p>Our commitment to our culture is demonstrated every day through the Hightower Way. By joining Hightower, you will build a community of inclusive relationships, take proactive ownership, embrace others’ perspectives, and have an uncompromising dedication to excellence.<p><br></p><strong> Your Future Team</strong><p><br></p>The Hightower Platform and Innovation group is growing and looking to add an Email Security Engineer, to work directly within the Technology Infrastructure team. This team is responsible for the firms; local/cloud, network, and unified communications infrastructure.<p><br></p><strong>What You’ll Do</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Serve as a Hightower brand ambassador by upholding The Hightower Way cultural elements – Mission, Purpose, V.A.L.U.E. title: Email Security Engineer
description: Rate: Open<p><br></p>Location: Hybrid role in either location<p><br></p>Chicago, IL/Dallas, TX<p><br></p><ul><li>Candidates must apply directly to this job posting for consideration*</li><li>Third Party Agency emails/calls will be denied*</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field</li><li>Basic understanding of software development, DevOps, and IT support practices</li><li>Familiarity with one or more Scripting languages such as Python, Bash, or PowerShell</li><li>Knowledge of Linux and/or Windows operating systems</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Assist in the documentation of DevOps and support processes, procedures, and best practices</li><li>Refine and maintain dashboards and monitoring systems to ensure uptime and availability of systems</li><li>Collaborate with DevOps and Support teams to identify opportunities for process improvement and automation</li><li>Help maintain system configuration, software installations, and patches</li><li>Provide 24x7 support for critical systems and services</li></ul>

title: Contract - Enterprise Monitoring
description: Want to learn more about this role and Jobot? Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!<p><br></p>Job details<p><br></p><strong>100% REMOTE Information Security Engineer Needed for a Leading Healthcare Organization!</strong><p><br></p>This Jobot Job is hosted by Reed Kellick<p><br></p>Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button and sending us your resume.<p><br></p>Salary $60,000 - $90,000 per year<p><br></p><strong>A Bit About Us</strong><p><br></p>We are a leading healthcare organization that employs 10s of thousands of people and has been around for decades. We are on the lookout for a talented IT Security Engineer!<p><br></p><strong><br><br><strong>Why join us?<br></strong></strong><p><br></p>As an Infosec Engineer in our company, we are able to offer<p><br></p><ul><li> A competitive base salary between $60k and $90k, depending on experience!</li><li> 401k!</li><li> Medical, dental and vision coverage!</li><li> Competitive PTO/vacation!</li><li> Work from home / work remotely 100%</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Details</strong><p><br></p>As an Information Technology Security Engineer on our team, we are looking for<p><br></p><ul><li> Must be open to the $60k to $90k salary range listed on this ad</li><li> Minimum of 3 years in system and/or security administration in a heavy Windows and light-nix environment.</li><li> 3+ years of SIEM architecting and support; web and spam filtering using secure web proxies and email filtering solutions; security framework implementation; other end-user, network, and host-based security solutions.</li><li> Enterprise Information Security Products and Services; Security Frameworks; Advanced use of MS Office applications</li><li> Desired 5 + years in the administration or monitoring of SIEMs and vulnerability management systems within an enterprise environment; secure web gateways; remote access technologies; endpoint protection methodologies; secure configuration of routers and switches, Microsoft Windows Active Directory, IBM iSeries (AS/400) OS400, UNIX systems; web application development, infrastructure, and database security; audit and compliance adherence and processes (e.g. HIPAA mostly, some PCI).</li><li> Desired Advanced knowledge of Splunk and McAfee SIEMs, NIST CSF and associated NIST Standards, Tenable products, and MS Office applications.</li><li> Desired GCIH, OSCP, CPP, CISSP, GCIA, or CCSP.</li></ul><p><br></p>Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button.<p><br></p><strong>Want to learn more about this role and Jobot?</strong><p><br></p>Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!<p><br></p>

title: Security Engineer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong>:<p><br></p><ul><li>Infrastructure/DevOps engineering background </li><li>OpenShift/Kubernetes/Helm</li><li>Jenkins (CI/CD)</li><li>Golang</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Hasicorp Vault</li><li>AWS RDS (Postgresql)</li><li>Redis Enterprise administration</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong>Requires Secret Clearance<br><br></strong>Designs, develops, troubleshoots, and analyzes computer software. Reviews architecture and selects and integrates appropriate development and support tools to ensure product performance. Investigates, identifies, and resolves code issues logged internally by QA or end users. Develops and maintains documentation.<br><br><strong><u>Job Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Works with user groups to solve business problems with available technology including hardware, software, databases, and peripherals.</li><li> Develops and implements processes that enable agile teaming to maximize talent utilization across the customer organization.</li><li> In depth understanding of emerging IT technologies in order to create directorate level business processes</li><li> Partners with various stakeholder organization's to lead planning and business process improvement efforts.</li><li> Establishes needed processes, governance structures, performance metrics and reporting.</li><li> Applies expert functional knowledge and experience to significant business projects or processes.</li><li> Maintains expertise by in-depth involvement in the state-of-the-art research and technology development in the field.</li><li> Monitors and/or participates in industry user forums, working groups in area of expertise.</li><li> As needed, identifies the most qualified internal resources and/or contractor team to assist with tasks. Selects contractors, frames statements of work, and directs the work of the team to assure technical and financial milestones are met.</li><li> May lead a small team of capable technical staff members and advises/mentors developing technical staff, does not have direct management responsibility.</li><li> Coaches and mentors internal staff in associated technical areas of expertise.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Bachelor's Degree in a related field; Master's Degree preferred<br><br>15+ years of experience in a technical field<br><br>Tech Stack/Tool Suite to be used include and which expertise is required<br><ul><li> React 16.11.0</li><li> Bootstrap 4.3.1</li><li> jQuery 1.12.4</li><li> Node.js 10.24.1</li><li> Yarn 1.22.5</li><li> Jest 24.9.0</li><li> Ruby 2.6.8</li><li> Rails 5.1.7</li><li> RubyGems 3.0.3.1</li><li> Rack version 2.2.3</li><li> Rspec 3.10</li><li> MySQL (Rails uses mysql2 gem v0.5.3 as adapter)</li><li> AWS commercial services - SQS, DynamoDB, SNS</li><li> REST APIs</li><li> Angular</li><li> Java</li><li> Python</li><li> Groovy</li><li> Vue v2.0</li><li> Vuetify v1.5</li><li> FeathersJS v6.1</li><li> Sequelize v5.21</li><li> Axios v0.18</li><li> Express.js v4.16</li><li> AWS RDS for PostgreSQL</li><li> AWS Simple Storage Service (S3)</li><li> Docker</li><li> AWS Lambda<br></li></ul><strong><u>Other Job Specific Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li> Process oriented, conceptually driven and possess the ability to think strategically and work collaboratively in a highly technical setting.</li><li> Demonstrated success in developing strategic goals and leading complex programs.</li><li> Experience with project development lifecycle and systems operations.</li><li> Proven ability to interact with customers, senior leadership and program managers in a highly matrixed environment.</li><li> Proven ability to develop and extend network of working level contacts to facilitate behind the scenes coordination.</li><li> Proven experience in designing, developing, and delivering executive level communication on organization transformation and business process changes. Ability to prepare presentations and to present information to senior managers. * Ability to work and apply creativity in a fast paced environment.</li><li> Utilize creative problem-solving and communication--oral and written--skills, emphasizing the abilities to articulate, explain, and deliver technical concepts and issues to non-technical business leadership.</li><li> Recognized in field of expertise as an expert.<br></li></ul><strong>Certifications/Licensures<br><br></strong>Industry leading certification for technical expertise preferred<br><br>#cjpost

title: Application Developer
description: <strong>Description</strong><p><br></p>Are you looking to prove that you're a creative technical thinker with excellent problem solving skills and the ability to communicate to diverse audiences? If you fit that description, apply for Robert Half's opening for a Systems Engineer! This position is a key contributor to the maintenance and optimization of the client's network and wireless infrastructure, so our Systems Engineer must be prepared for such duties. This permanent employment opportunity is based in the Chicago, Illinois area. Apply for this role today!<p><br></p>Your responsibilities<p><br></p><ul><li> Submit 2nd and 3rd level support</li><li> Keep an eye on and test application performance for potential bottlenecks, discern possible solutions, and concur with developers to put into practice those fixes</li><li> Configure, test, install, and maintain application software, operating systems, and system management tools</li><li> Consistently deliver the highest levels of systems and infrastructure availability</li><li> Provide backup, redundancy strategies, and security</li><li> Indite and assert custom scripts to increase system efficiency and lower the human intervention time on any tasks</li><li> Play a part in the design of information and operational support systems</li><li> Band together with vendors and other IT personnel for problem resolution</li><li> Supervise and track all installed systems and infrastructure</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Proven working experience in installing, configuring and troubleshooting various operating systems</li><li> Microsoft Azure experience</li><li> Dell Technologies experience</li><li> Well-founded grasp of VMware</li><li> Proven knowledge of Commvault</li><li> Linux experience required</li><li> Experience with NetApp</li><li> SANs (Storage Area Networks) experience</li><li> This position will be the best fit for a candidate who have solid networking knowledge</li><li> 5+ years of relevant experience - Experience with virtualization and containerization</li><li> This position will be the best fit for a candidate with solid experience in the administration and performance tuning of application stacks</li><li> Applicants should have experience with monitoring systems</li><li> Experience with automation software is required for success at this position</li><li> Solid scripting skills</li></ul><p><br></p>Technology Doesn't Change the World, People Do.®<p><br></p>Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.<p><br></p>Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity – even on the go.<p><br></p>All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Benefits are available to contract/temporary professionals, including medical, vision, dental, and life and disability insurance. Hired contract/temporary professionals are also eligible to enroll in our company 401(k) plan. Visit<p><br></p>© 2023 Robert Half. An Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/Disability/Veterans. By clicking “Apply Now,” you’re agreeing to

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: Help global companies embrace the latest private cloud infrastructure, Linux and cloud native operations, and open source applications. Our team applies expert insights to real-world customer problems, enabling the enterprise adoption of Linux Ubuntu, OpenStack, Kubernetes and a wide range of associated technology.<p><br></p>This role has very diverse responsibilities. The team members are Linux and cloud solutions architects for our customers, designing private and public cloud solutions fitting their workload needs. They are the cloud consultants who work hands-on with the technologies by deploying, testing and handing over the solution to our support or managed services team at the end of a project. They are also software engineers who use Python to develop Kubernetes operators and Linux open source infrastructure-as-code.<p><br></p>The people who love this role are developers who like to solve customer problems through architecture, presentations and training.<p><br></p>What you'll do:<p><br></p><ul><li>Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications</li><li>Design and deploy clouds and applications for external customers</li><li>Architect cloud infrastructure solutions like OpenStack, Kubernetes, Ceph, Hadoop and Spark either On-Premises or in Public Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)</li><li>Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values</li><li>Work from the comfort of your home</li><li>Global travel up to 25% of time for internal and external events</li></ul><p><br></p>Who you are:<p><br></p><ul><li>University degree in Computer Science or related software engineering expertise</li><li>You have expertise in AI/ML and MLOps</li><li>You have practical knowledge of Linux and networking</li><li>You have sound knowledge of cloud computing concepts &amp; technologies, such as Kubernetes, Openstack, AWS, GCP, Azure, Ceph, etc. </li><li>You have an intermediate level of Python programming skills</li><li>You are a dynamic person who loves to jump in new projects and interact with people</li><li>You have a demonstrated drive for continual learning</li><li>Excellent communication and presentation skills (English, Spanish/French a bonus)</li><li>You have great organisational skills and follow-up reliably on commitments</li></ul><p><br></p>What you'll learn<p><br></p><ul><li>OpenStack and Kubernetes infrastructure</li><li>Linux Ubuntu and networking knowledge</li><li>Wide range of open source applications and skills</li><li>Work directly with customers in a range of different businesses </li><li>Real-life and hands-on exposure to a wide range of emerging technologies and tools </li></ul><p><br></p>We offer:<p><br></p><ul><li>Learning and development tuition reimbursement</li><li>18 weeks parental leave (USA) </li><li>Diversity Resource Groups</li><li>Work from home</li><li>Competitive salary</li><li>Recognition rewards</li><li>Annual leave</li><li>Priority Pass for travel</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Canonical</strong><p><br></p>Canonical is a growing, international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu -- the world's #1 cloud operating system. Our mission is to realize the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services help businesses worldwide reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.<p><br></p><em>Canonical is a remote-first workplace and will hire candidates in their current living location. For applicants applying from the United States, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, as we cannot offer visa sponsorship for this job opening.</em><p><br></p><em>We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background leads to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.</em><p><br></p>#stack<p><br></p>

title: Cloud Field Engineer - Americas (Remote)
description: Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, gt.school. Have you got what it takes?<p><br></p>Are you ready to revolutionize education with the power of cutting-edge technology? We're seeking strategic problem solvers who thrive on developing and implementing innovative solutions and are eager to apply the power of generative AI to supercharge their work. Your consistent high performance and dedication will drive our mission to revolutionize education.<p><br></p>At gt.school, we're on a mission to accelerate the pace of learning by 5-10X, harnessing the incredible potential of technology, algorithms, and generative AI. We are creating a platform where students can discover, explore, and learn at an unprecedented rate. You'll play a pivotal role in bringing this vision to life. You'll have the opportunity to build new tools and operational processes, as well as streamline existing workflows for maximum efficiency.<p><br></p>But that's not all! At gt.school, we believe in your growth and development. You'll receive regular coaching and training from a team of global tech experts and operations professionals, ensuring your continuous improvement. We value collaboration and provide a supportive environment where you can meet with team members to work together on exciting projects.<p><br></p>If you're eager for a role that combines research, strategy, product development, and data science in the ever-evolving realm of education and technology, seize the moment and apply below. Let's embark on this exhilarating journey together!<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Engineering generative AI prompts in Python/JavaScript/JSON</li><li>Analyze AI outputs and iterate on prompts to reach desired outcomes</li><li>Leverage generative AI and technology to develop new educational tools, iterate on current products, and finetune AI training models</li><li>Research topics to support the product engineering team</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You Won’t Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collecting data or performing administrative tasks - we have a junior operations analyst team to do this type of work.</li><li>Working on unimportant projects - you'll be tasked with projects that are mission-critical</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Data Scientist Key Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>Create technical functionalities that revolutionize the way education is delivered.<p><br></p><strong><u>Basic Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent written and verbal English communication skills</li><li>Proficient in Python, R, JavaScript, or another OOP language</li><li>2+ years of work experience working in a technical field (science, technology, programming, financial services, data science, etc.)</li><li>Consistently able to work 40 hours per week, Monday through Friday, between 6AM and 6PM CST</li><li>Must be a proactive communicator who can effectively manage multiple priorities and stakeholders simultaneously</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Gt.school</u></strong><p><br></p>gt.school is a stealth EdTech startup in Austin, Texas, the center of educational innovation in the US. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and high-performance life skills coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn 5x faster and unlock their full potential in both academics and in life. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.<p><br></p>There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!<p><br></p><strong>Working with Crossover</strong><p><br></p>This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.<p><br></p><strong>What to expect next:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.</li><li>Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Important!</strong> If you do not receive an email from us:<p><br></p><ul><li>First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.</li><li>Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.</li><li>Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.</li><li>If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.</li></ul> Crossover Job Code: LJ-4880-US-Chicago-DataScientist<p><br></p>
industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Technology, Information and Internet

Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.<p><br></p><strong>What to expect next:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.</li><li>Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Important!</strong> If you do not receive an email from us:<p><br></p><ul><li>First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.</li><li>Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.</li><li>Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.</li><li>If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.</li></ul> Crossover Job Code: LJ-4880-US-Chicago-DataScientist<p><br></p>

title: AWS Node JS Developer
description: Are you passionate about mitigating risk and ensuring compliance? Do you have an eye for detail and love digging into data to uncover potential issues? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you! As the AML Analyst for our client’s U.S. Commercial Know Your Customer (KYC) team, you will play a crucial role in supporting compliance for our U.S. Commercial Bank lines of business. You will work directly with the banking and sales teams, as well as the U.S. AML Office and High Risk Unit, to gather required documents and data, assess customer AML risk, and generate AML KYC Checklists.<p><br></p><ul><li>Responsibilities:*</li><li>Respond to onboarding and update requests from Commercial Banking and TPS Sales teams.</li><li>Gather required customer AML data and enter it into the AML book of record system (CMCIF) to create or update KYC Checklists.</li><li>Review deal files, third party websites, and system information to augment data.</li><li>Adjudicate hits on any system name searches by consulting with internal OFAC Unit.</li><li>Work with the U.S. AML Office High Risk Unit to assess and update high-risk ratings as needed.</li><li>Accurately maintain Livelink folders, scanning all current information.</li><li>Complete clients’ AML annual reviews, drafting revised KYC Checklists, and requesting approval from RM and TPS Sales representatives.</li><li>Advise lines of business regarding AML information and documentation requirements.</li><li>Serve as the main point of contact for status updates on AML processing.</li><li>Accurately and thoroughly complete final KYC Checklist and electronic storage of all related supporting documentation.</li><li>Manage several requests simultaneously, prioritizing as needed.</li><li>Conduct peer quality assurance reviews.</li><li>Interact with staff of all levels in U.S. Commercial Banking and the U.S. AML Office High Risk Unit for issue resolution or escalation.</li><li>Maintain up-to-date subject matter expertise in the areas of AML and banking regulations.</li><li>Assist the Team Leader with training and act as a “go-to” person for less experienced Analysts.</li><li>Identify any gaps, issues, and best practices and raise them to the management team.</li><li>Requirements:*</li><li>Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, or related field.</li><li>Strong analytical and communication skills.</li><li>Knowledge of banking regulations and compliance requirements.</li><li>Ability to manage multiple requests simultaneously and prioritize as needed.</li><li>Attention to detail and accuracy.</li><li>Beginner understanding of French is a plus!</li></ul><p><br></p>About Aston Carter:<p><br></p>Please Note: Scammers are posing as Aston Carter. We'll never contact you via Gmail, Telegram, or WhatsApp and we'll never solicit money from you.<p><br></p>At Aston Carter, we’re dedicated to expanding career opportunities for the skilled professionals who power our business. Our success is driven by the talented, motivated people who join our team across a range of positions – from recruiting, sales and delivery to corporate roles. As part of our team, employees have the opportunity for long-term career success, where hard work is rewarded and the potential for growth is limitless. Established in 1997, Aston Carter is a leading staffing and consulting firm, providing high-caliber talent and premium services to more than 7,000 companies across North America. Spanning four continents and more than 200 offices, we extend our clients’ capabilities by seeking solvers and delivering solutions to address today’s workforce challenges. For organizations looking for innovative solutions shaped by critical-thinking professionals, visit [AstonCarter.com.](AstonCarter.com) Aston Carter is a company within Allegis Group, a global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law. If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to a disability, please call 888-237-6835 or email [astoncarteraccommodation@astoncarter.com](mailto:%20astoncarteraccommodation@astoncarter.com) for other accommodation options. However, if you have questions about this position, please contact the Recruiter located at the bottom of the job posting. The Recruiter is the sole point of contact for questions about this position.

title: AML Analyst - Entry Level
description: *We are unable to sponsor for this permanent Full time role*<p><br></p>*Position is bonus eligible*<p><br></p>Prestigious Financial Company is currently seeking a C# Risk Modeling Developer. Candidate will be responsible for supporting a firmwide development project. While writing C#, ASP.NET code, you will provide support for the review and signoff of the test plans and test results.<p><br></p>The goal is also to support the development of MRM's independent verification testing capabilities for the Risk Pillar. This will include creating MRM's independent implementation of the financial risk models. You should be able to solve problems creatively, communicate effectively, and proactively, engage in technical decision making to achieve these objectives. This individual will be a team player who can easily work well with business, technical and non-technical professionals, in an Agile environment.<p><br></p><strong><u>Technical Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>7+ years .NET and C# development experience 5+ years of JavaScript experience, including React and typescript.</li><li>2+ years working in Cloud environment.</li><li>2+ years Java development, 3+ years developing quantitative financial models.</li><li>Experience as architect for both Front End and Back End solutions. Experience with RESTful APIs Experience following Git workflows Working knowledge of DevOps tools. Eg Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Helm and CI/CD pipeline etc. Familiarity with monitoring related tools and frameworks like Splunk, ElasticSearch, Prometheus, AppDynamics</li><li>Experience working in a large project team, principally with financial data.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Review and signoff of test plans and results for Risk Pillar of Renaissance Initiative.</li><li>Maintenance of MRM's custom Risk Systems Control Tool. This includes the development and delivery of business features in the application's Front End, middle layer, and Back End.</li><li>Deployment for MVG's Risk System Control Tool in an AWS environment to facilitate MRM's Renaissance testing activities. Inclusive of integration with AWS data sources.</li><li>Development of quantitative financial models into MRM's modelling infrastructure with focus on computational performance. Participates in code reviews, proactively identifying and mitigating potential issues and defects while assisting with continuous improvement; Emphasis on clean coding standards. Must be a self-starter, independent and comfortable with a fast paced, dynamic environment. A team player who assists the team as required to achieve collective goals &amp; delivery milestones including knowledge-share. Actively participates in creation and review of both business and technical user stories, providing constructive feedback and input on both work effort estimation as well as architecture/design improvements. Participate in innovative design, proof of concept(s) with emerging technologies and solutions. Embrace industry best practices like continuous integration, continuous deployment, automated testing, TDD etc. Will write unit and integration tests, based on chosen DevOps frameworks. Maintain the MRM IT infrastructure, such as the collection of Servers, data bases, and management of share drives.</li><li>BS degree in Computer Science, or similar technical field required. Masters strongly preferred.</li></ul>

description: Rate: Open<p><br></p>Location: Hybrid role in either location<p><br></p>Chicago, IL/Dallas, TX<p><br></p><ul><li>Candidates must apply directly to this job post for consideration*</li><li>Third Party Agency calls/emails will be denied*</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>At least 5 years of executing automation scripts using open-source tools.</li><li>Experience writing &amp; executing automated testing utilizing various tools</li><li>Work in functional &amp; Integration testing of UI, APIs and cloud based dockerized applications</li><li>Work experience in monitoring and troubleshooting in a cloud based applications</li><li>Experience working with SQL and NO_SQL databases</li><li>Experience working with modern SDLC including CI/CD and infrastructure as code (involving terraform, ansible and helm charts)</li><li>Experience with any form of Scripting or OO programming (preferred).</li><li>Understanding of different database technologies SQL/No-SQL for testing implications.</li><li>Experience testing full stack and integration testing with 3rd parties</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Produce traceable artifacts (wiki page, Jira, FAQs) that will help team build center of excellence on testing.</li><li>Champions testing methodologies, best practices, and standards.</li><li>Build test automation framework, as well as integrating test automation with the company's CI/CD/build pipelines</li><li>Write self-documenting and well-structured tests that will be easy to work with and adapt for fellow SDETs.</li><li>Assist in training project team members to execute, analyze, and maintain automated regression suites</li><li>Coordinate with product owner to resolve open issues/enhancements/upgrades and understand the use of a specific functionality as needed</li><li>Use automated functional scripts built using tools such as Citrus, Selenium, Rest Assured, Java, Junit, Gherkin Scripting in Cucumber or other open source or vended applications</li></ul>

title: Contract - QA/SDET
description: <ul><li>LOOKING FOR A NEW LABVIEW OPPORTUNITY?*</li><li>I have the one for you!* My client is currently hiring a tenured Labview Test Engineer to help test electronics during and post manufacturing. This client manufactures electronics and telematics offering for the automotive and telematics industry. This team develops manufacturing tests performed on every unit built to make sure it is free of manufacturing flaws, focusing on manufacturing defects.</li><li>Quote, Design, and Develop manufacturing test solutions for New Product Introduction</li><li>Develop software (C#, C, and NI TestStand) to control test instruments and Units Under Test in order to meet product test requirements</li><li>Demonstrate the ability to develop hardware and software for production test solutions</li><li>Experience interpreting MySQL database schema and writing database queries</li><li>Provide ongoing support for existing products related to ECOs, yield issues, reliability improvements, and other continuous improvement initiatives</li><li>Written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate with customers, suppliers, and internal project stakeholders</li><li>Manage project scopes and timelines and coordinate initiatives with Project Managers</li><li>Collaborate with Production Engineers and Supervisors to integrate test systems into the production process</li><li>Analyze test performance data and use production personnel input to drive test improvements opportunities</li><li>Ability to develop and interpret test requirements and identify test equipment required to meet those requirements</li><li>Ability to identify, assess, and resolve hardware and software issues</li><li>Compile and interpret Gage R&amp;R and CPK studies</li><li>Support Root Cause Analysis of field return issues and implement additional test coverage as needed</li><li>Create documentation describing test design concepts and operator instructions</li><li>Experience related to manufacturing Printed Circuit Board Assemblies</li><li>Participate in peer reviews of test solutions</li><li>Skills:* *</li><li>Labview*</li><li>C#</li><li>Test Stand</li><li>SQL</li><li>Manufacturing Test</li><li>Test Automation</li><li>Test development/design/procedure</li><li>Hardware</li><li>Debug</li><li>Test Fixture</li><li>Manufacturing</li><li>Write Test Scripts</li><li>Validation PLUS</li><li>Automotive is a plus not required though.</li><li>Experience developing tests for RF or wireless devices (i.e. Cellular, GPS, Bluetooth, WiFi)</li><li>Employee Perks:*</li><li>Paid Weekly</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plans</li><li>Abenity Discount Program</li><li>Udemy Courses</li><li>Work Life Balance</li><li>Experience Level:* 5+ years experience</li></ul><p><br></p>About Actalent:<p><br></p>Actalent connects though.</li><li>Experience developing tests for RF or wireless devices (i.e. Cellular, GPS, Bluetooth, WiFi)</li><li>Employee Perks:*</li><li>Paid Weekly</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plans</li><li>Abenity Discount Program</li><li>Udemy Courses</li><li>Work Life Balance</li><li>Experience Level:* 5+ years experience</li></ul><p><br></p>About Actalent:<p><br></p>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Test Engineer
description: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong><em>Position at Wind River<br><br></em><strong><u>About Wind River<br><br></u></strong>Wind River is a global leader in delivering software for mission-critical intelligent systems. For more than four decades, the company has been an innovator and pioneer, powering billions of systems that require the highest levels of security, safety, and reliability.<br><br>Wind River helps customers across automotive, aerospace, defense, industrial, medical, and telecommunications industries solve complex technology challenges on their journey toward the new intelligent machine economy.<br><br>The company’s software powers generation after generation of the safest, most secure systems in the world. Examples include playing a key role in NASA space missions — such as Artemis I, the James Webb Space Telescope, and multiple Mars rovers — and in recent 5G milestones — including the world’s first successful 5G data session with Verizon and in building one of the largest Open RAN networks in the world with Vodafone.<br><br>The company has received industry recognition for its technology innovation and leadership, and for its workplace culture, including global Great Place to Work certification and being named a “Top Workplace” for ten consecutive years. If you want to be part of a unique culture where the lived experience is based on our cultural attributes of growth mindset, customer-focus, and diversity, equity, inclusion &amp; belonging, come join us and help advance the future software defined world.<br><br><strong>Why Choose Wind River? <br><br></strong>For almost 40 years, Wind River has been the leading provider of embedded operating systems to the world’s leading developers of mission-critical infrastructure. Our customers include top Global 1000 companies across industries: Aerospace and Defense, Telecommunications, Industrial Controls and Robotics, Automotive, and Medical. Our VxWorks RTOS, Linux, and Helix Virtualization Platform power 2 billion-plus devices worldwide.<br><br>Within WindRiver, we have an opportunity to work with large-scale cloud native projects like Kubernetes, Docker and fast-paced open-source technologies. Wind River has adopted these technologies into the core of our product, which is driving us to find experienced and high-performing individuals that can learn and contribute towards secure development practices and securing these container and virtualization solutions.<br><br><strong><u>What You’ll Do<br><br></u></strong>WindRiver Systems is seeking an experienced high-performing professional, developing Site Reliability Engineering Function and offer shared services that spans across all products.<br><br>As the industry is moving intelligence to the Edge, this introduces challenges to ensure systems are highly available, reliable, free from threats and vulnerabilities. The successful candidate will join a highly skilled SRE and shared services team focused on implementing modern monitoring and observable platforms, enable systems for early detections, programmatically control the infrastructure, work on DevSecOps technologies, pioneer new tools, processes and capabilities for cloud-native solutions.<br><br>The candidate must have experience in cloud-native development environments and be a highly adaptable team player who can quickly ramp up on new technologies and accomplish goals in a fast-paced agile environment. A combination of strong technical and communication skills is a must, along with an unbounded desire to learn new technologies and their application.<br><br><strong><u>Who You Will Work With<br><br></u></strong>In SRE and Shared Services org, with primary focus on Site Reliability Engineering, Cloud Infrastructure Orchestration, Engineering Operations, Security implementation and you will work with Production Engineering, Software Development, QA and our Customer-facing teams to ensure requisite levels of infrastructure, application and software security/quality.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Drive the architectural efforts to improve resiliency, efficiency, performance, and costs.</li><li> Ensure the systems are highly reliable, available, free from threats &amp; vulnerabilities in cloud, internal environments, and applications for engineering stakeholders.</li><li> Write programs or scripts to replace manual tasks and automate the services to make it stable and operable.</li><li> Develop systems in place for the three pillars of observability- Logs, metrics, and traces. </li><li> Integrate various systems for better monitoring mechanisms in place by writing code, integrating APIs and plugins and prepare dashboards for better visibility.</li><li> Enabling systems for early problem detections with effective alerts &amp; monitors for cloud and on-prem infrastructure.</li><li> Be responsible to remediate tickets in Issue Tracking systems.</li><li> Be responsible to identify risks, defects, bottlenecks, and anything that can impair quality, availability, performance of deployed workloads/applications.</li><li> Secure OnPrem and Public Cloud environments leveraging IAC<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> 8+ relevant experience in cloud, DevOps, operations, security principles and trends with 2+ years of experience in software engineering.</li><li> Strong problem-solving, analytical skills, willing to take up complex challenges and triage environmental issues.</li><li> Strong programming &amp; scripting experience using Python, Shell, Java, C#, Yaml, Json, Restful API services etc.</li><li> Extensive experience in public cloud service like AWS, Azure, GCP and on-prem servers.</li><li> Extensive experience in Linux/Unix systems and networking fundamentals. </li><li> Extensive experience in monitoring &amp; logging tools such as Grafana, CheckMK, Prometheus, Loki, Elastic search, Kibana etc.</li><li> Extensive experience in DevOps tools such as Jenkins, Bitbucket, Gitlab etc.</li><li> Extensive experience with container ecosystems such as Docker, Kubernetes, Kubeflow etc.</li><li> Excellent knowledge in microservices, VMs deployments, Windows &amp; Linux servers.</li><li> Good knowledge in maintaining Kubernetes clusters, ensuring security, compliance and 24/7 availability of deployed workloads.</li><li> Good knowledge in AWS Cloud formation, Infra automation using Terraform, chef, ansible or puppet.</li><li> Understanding of relevant database technologies (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, etc.)</li><li> Thorough understanding of Agile, Scrum and SaFe Agile principles. </li><li> Self-managed, fast learner, and aptitude to learn quickly.</li><li> Excellent verbal and written communication skills and a good listener.</li><li> Exceptional team player who works well in collaborative situations.</li><li> Ability to brainstorm and represent competing ideas simultaneously.</li><li> Growth mindset who is passionate about learning and applying new technologies.</li><li> BS / MS degree (Computer Science, Electronics Engineering, or equivalent technical degree)<br></li></ul><strong><u>Benefits<br></u></strong><ul><li> Flexible home office! We offer the flexibility of a hybrid work schedule or 100% remote</li><li> Named Top Workplace for the 8th year in a row</li><li> Wind River’s commitment to DEIB</li><li> 100% Employee covered Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance*</li><li> Flexible Time Off policy* + 12 observed Holidays</li><li> 401K with company match</li><li> Health Savings Account (HSA) and Flexible Spending Account (FSA)</li><li> Wellness Benefits through Unmind</li><li>varies by region and country<br></li></ul><strong><u>Compensation<br><br></u></strong>The annual base salary range for this role’s listed grade level is currently $122,100-$165,780 plus bonus for Colorado residents, New York and New Jersey residents, and $135,100-$182,420 plus bonus for California and Washington residents. Salary ranges are determined through interviews and a review of education, experience, knowledge, skills, location and abilities of the applicant, and equity with other team members. Employees in this role are also eligible for the following benefits in accordance with the terms of the Company's plans: health, dental, vision insurance, life insurance, flex time off, eligibility to enroll in 401k, 12 paid holidays.

title: Shared Services / Site Reliability Engineer
description: <p><strong>Job Summary:<br><br></strong></p><p>Dexian is seeking a AS400 iSeries Cobol Programmer for an opportunity with a client located in Lombard, IL.<br><br></p><p><strong>Responsibilities:<br><br></strong></p><ul><li>Design programs, create user interfaces, document code</li><li>Plan and execute testing (including regression testing) to ensure the program meets the specified requirements</li><li>Work with user/customer community to capture system requirements</li><li>Communicate technical concepts to non-technical people and communicates business ideas to technical people</li><li>Design new systems that may be complex and cross platforms</li><li>Manage projects that require work from departments outside his/her own</li><li>Create project plans and offer alternatives to project sponsors</li><li>Communicate project status and issues</li><li>Enforce good development practices</li><li>Determine and correct errors where problems may span systems</li></ul><p><strong>Requirements</strong>:<br><br></p><ul><li>Experienced business modeling and requirements definition disciplines through Unified Modeling Language (UML), use cases</li><li>Extensive Experience in COBOL programming language a plus! But will teach the person with the necessary drive and technical aptitude!</li><li>Candidates must have held an active IRS MBI clearance within the last 2 years to qualify</li><li>5+ years in the specific software application of mainframe version of Advanced Loan System (ALS)</li></ul><p> <br><br></p><p> <br><br><br></p><strong>Desired Skills and Experience<br><br></strong>AS400 Cobol Programmer.    <br>Fully Remote<br>6 month contract, Potential to Extend<br>40 hours per week M-F (CST hours.)<br>Looking at mid-senior level candidates<br><br>MUST HAVE:<br>- 5+ years of experience<br>- Cobol programming on AS400<br>- iSeries<br><br>NICE TO HAVE:<br>- RPG Free<br>- Insurance industry experience<br><br><br><br><p>Dexian is a leading provider of staffing, IT, and workforce solutions with over 12,000 employees and 70 locations worldwide. As one of the largest IT staffing companies and the 2nd largest minority-owned staffing company in the U.S., Dexian was formed in 2023 through the merger of DISYS and Signature Consultants. Combining the best elements of its core companies, Dexian's platform connects talent, technology, and organizations to produce game-changing results that help everyone achieve their ambitions and goals.<br><br></p><br><p>Dexian's brands include Dexian DISYS, Dexian Signature Consultants, Dexian Government Solutions, Dexian Talent Development and Dexian IT Solutions. Visit www.dexian.com to learn more.<br><br></p><br><p>Dexian is an Equal Opportunity Employer that recruits and hires qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, disability, or veteran status.<br><br></p>
