title: AS400 iSeries Cobol Programmer
description: <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Infosys is seeking <strong>ServiceNow Developer</strong>. This role requires close partnership and collaboration with other Business Stakeholders and Subject Matter Experts. Essential Job Duties include working on complex ServiceNow ITSM modules, DevOps modules, Integration with other DevOps tools, deployments and integrations aligned to Industry best practices and translating functional &amp; technical requirements into implementation work package. Should be able to interact with the different architecture, platforms, application and infrastructure teams to understand and design the solution.<p><br></p><strong><u>Required Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Candidate must be located within commuting distance of Chicago, IL, or be willing to relocate to the area. This position may require travel in the US</li><li> Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent required from an accredited institution. Will also consider three years of progressive experience in the specialty in lieu of every year of education</li><li> At least 4 years of Information Technology experience</li><li> 2 years of experience in implementing IT Service Management, ITIL processes and Enterprise Service Management.</li><li> Experience in Development/ Configuration/solutions evaluation/ Validation and deployment</li><li> Experience in capturing requirements related to internal/external consulting, documenting, and mapping current business process</li><li> Working knowledge in all aspects of ServiceNow Applications development and Rest API based integrations with 3rd party applications</li><li> Experience in working with multi-vendor development environment</li><li> ServiceNow DevOps Module Administration for Automated Change Creation.</li><li> Provide support for ServiceNow issues including the issue related to ServiceNow DevOps Module</li><li> Administrating ServiceNow REST APIs</li><li> ServiceNow Reporting</li><li> U.S. citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor this time.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Excellent Communications and client interaction skills along with exceptional written and verbal skills as well as technical documentation</li><li> Must be well-organized, be able to work independently, and have strong ability to effectively multi-task and problem solving</li><li> Maintain high customer service levels by effectively working with team members, other internal organizations, vendors, and customers</li><li> Extraordinary Planning, Project Management, Coordination, and Analytical skills</li><li> Hands-on experience in working in Global Delivery Model with onsite/offshore resources</li><li> Ability to work in the Offshore and Onshore model</li><li> Must be able to work in highly dynamic environment of project deliverable</li><li> Exceptional Organizational Skills</li><li> Ability to manage and prioritize tasks efficiently</li><li> Readiness to demonstrate a proactive attitude</li><li> Integrate ServiceNow with other DevOps Tools like GitHub Actions, Azure Boards as part of ServiceNow DevOps Module Administration</li><li> Certified ServiceNow Implementation Specialist, ITIL is a plus</li></ul><p><br></p>The job entails sitting as well as working at a computer for extended periods of time. Should be able to communicate by telephone, email, or face to face.<p><br></p><strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in more than 50 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over four decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.<p><br></p>Visit www.infosys.com to see how <strong>Infosys (NYSE: INFY)</strong> can help your enterprise navigate your next.<p><br></p><strong>Infosys is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, spouse of protected veteran, or disability.</strong>

description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Wipro Ltd., is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p><strong>About Wipro</strong><p><br></p>Wipro Limited (NYSE: WIT, BSE: 507685, NSE: WIPRO) is a leading technology services and consulting company focused on building innovative solutions that address clients' most complex digital transformation needs.<p><br></p>We leverage our holistic portfolio of capabilities in consulting, design, engineering, operations, and emerging technologies to help clients realize their boldest ambitions and build future-ready, sustainable businesses.<p><br></p>A company recognized globally for its comprehensive portfolio of services, strong commitment to sustainability and good corporate citizenship, we have over 250,000 dedicated employees serving clients across 66 countries.<p><br></p>We deliver on the promise of helping our customers, colleagues, and communities thrive in an ever-changing world.<p><br></p><ul><li> A PROUD HISTORY OF OVER 75 YEARS</li><li> FY22 REVENUE 10.4 BN USD</li><li> WE'RE PRESENT IN 66 COUNTRIES</li><li> OVER 1,400 ACTIVE GLOBAL CLIENTS</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Role</strong><p><br></p>Nintex Developer<p><br></p><strong>Key Skills</strong><p><br></p>Nintex, JavaScript, jQuery<p><br></p><strong>Location</strong><p><br></p>Chicago, IL<p><br></p><strong>Experience</strong><p><br></p>4+ Years<p><br></p><strong>Role Description</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Primary Skills: title: Tandem Developer
description: <strong>Role</strong>: Axiom Developer / IT – Application Architect<br><br><strong>Start date</strong>: June<br><br>Contract through April with possibility of FTE conversion<br><br>100% remote or local to Chicago<br><br>Our client, a Chicago based global financial institution, is looking for an Axiom SL Developer to join their team. Exciting opportunity for a candidate who has a strong Axiom background and looking for their next career move.<br><br>The successful candidate will support various projects for the Cash business unit, specifically 2023 GRS NA &amp; GRS EMEA strategic projects. Will play a key role in some of the development &amp; support activities related to these projects. For example, configure objects and reports in Axiom.<br><br><u><strong>Skills – must haves:</strong></u> <ul><li>AXIOM SL – developer (not tester)</li><ul><li>3 years minimum of Axiom SL controller view development experience </li></ul><li>IT development experience (6-8 years minimum) </li><li>Axiom database maintenance </li><li>Code development – develop data models, data sources, objects </li><li>Change management – will support SAT &amp; UAT &amp; into production, post production support, batch processing, and upgrade patches </li><li>Collaboration skills – Work across different teams (QAs and Business teams) </li><li>Experience configuring regulatory reports </li><li>Communication skills </li><li>Strong references <br><br></li></ul><u><strong>Nice to have:<br></strong></u><ul><li>Work in teams internally and with vendors, in the US and India </li><li>Financial services </li><li>Regulatory Reporting &amp; Data Warehousing </li><li>US regulatory reports knowledge / experience – FFIEC031, FFIEC041, FFIEC009 etc. <br><br></li></ul><em>Heitmeyer Consulting is an equal opportunity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to minority status, gender, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.</em>

title: Developer III - 13069
description: Summary Accenture Flex offers you the flexibility of local fixed-duration project-based work powered by Accenture, a leading global professional services company. Accenture is consistently recognized on FORTUNE's 100 Best Companies to Work For and Diversity Inc's Top 50 Companies For Diversity lists.As an Accenture Flex employee, you will apply your skills and experience to help drive business transformation for leading organizations and communities. In addition to delivering innovative solutions for Accenture's clients, you will work with a highly skilled, diverse network of people across Accenture businesses who are using the latest emerging technologies to address today's biggest business challenges.You will receive competitive rewards and access to benefits programs and world-class learning resources. Accenture Flex employees work in their local metro area onsite at the project, significantly reducing and/or eliminating the demands to travel.Candidate will be required to develop Ui s using react JS frameworks, migrate existing legacy applications to React JS using rapid development model.Design, Develop, test and document highly reliable, scalable systems in a structured fast moving environment.End to end development responsibilities and tasks.Hybrid role. Expected to be onsite 3 days per week in Chicago, IL. Qualifications Basic Requirements:5 years of experience with React JS5 years of UI Development experience2 years of Python developmentMust be available onsite 3 days per week in Chicago, IL.Preferred Qualifications:FX/Capital Markets experienceCompensation at Accenture varies depending on a wide array of factors, which may include but are not limited to the specific office location, role, skill set, and level of experience. As required by local law, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in Albany County, NY, California, Colorado, New York City or Washington as set forth below. Information on benefits is here.Role LocationCalifornia - $58.65 - $68.65 per hourColorado - $58.65 - $68.65 per hourNew York - Albany - $58.65 - $68.65 per hourNew York City - $58.65 - $68.65 per hourWashington - $58.65 - $68.65 per hour What We Believe We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Read more here Equal Employment Opportunity StatementAccenture is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation.All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.For details, view a copy of the Accenture Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Policy Statement.Requesting An AccommodationAccenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired.If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with Accenture and have accommodation needs for a disability or religious observance, please call us toll free at 1 (877) 889-9009, send us an email or speak with your recruiter.Other Employment StatementsApplicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States.Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Company's legal duty to furnish information.PDN-995f97e7-a32d-484a-8d66-6a7c704598c9

title: Application Developer - React JS - 4799812
description: Rate: Open<p><br></p>Location: Hybrid role in either location<p><br></p>Chicago, IL/Dallas, TX<p><br></p><ul><li>Candidates must apply directly to this job post for consideration*</li><li>Third Party Agency calls/emails will be denied*</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Java 8+ experience required, including deep understanding of Java fundamentals as Memory Model, Runtime Environment, Concurrency and Multithreading.</li><li>Experience with Kafka</li><li>Java persistence layers and SQLs</li><li>Working knowledge of DevOps tools. Eg Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Helm and CI/CD pipeline etc.</li><li>Deep knowledge of RESTful standards and practice.</li><li>Experience in computer algorithms and data structures, including ability to articulate and apply in practice different type of sorting, hashing, partitioning, and search operations.</li><li>Ability to identify both time and memory complexity for the written code.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Primarily responsibility is application development following API driven micro-services and micro-applications architecture for given business requirements adhering agile SDLC.</li><li>Analyzes requirements, develops, tests, and documents software quality to ensure proper implementation.</li><li>Follows agreed upon SDLC procedures to ensure that all information system products and services meet: both explicit and implicit quality standards, end-user functional requirements, architectural standards, performance requirements, audit requirements, security rules are upheld, and external facing reporting is properly represented.</li><li>Application and project risk analysis and recommends quality improvements.</li><li>Providing advice on system functionality and fixes as required</li></ul>

They are looking to add a Sr. Test Engineer to help Test Electronics during and post manufacturing.</li><li>Responsibilites:*</li><li>Quote, Design, and Develop manufacturing test solutions for New Product Introduction</li><li>Develop software (C#, C, and NI TestStand) to control test instruments and Units Under Test in order to meet product test requirements</li><li>Demonstrate the ability to develop hardware and software for production test solutions</li><li>Experience interpreting MySQL database schema and writing database queries</li><li>Provide ongoing support for existing products related to ECOs, yield issues, reliability improvements, and other continuous improvement initiatives</li><li>Written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate with customers, suppliers, and internal project stakeholders</li><li>Manage project scopes and timelines and coordinate initiatives with Project Managers</li><li>Collaborate with Production Engineers and Supervisors to integrate test systems into the production process</li><li>Analyze test performance data and use production personnel input to drive test improvements opportunities</li><li>Ability to develop and interpret test requirements and identify test equipment required to meet those requirements</li><li>Ability to identify, assess, and resolve hardware and software issues</li><li>Compile and interpret Gage R&amp;R and Cpk studies</li><li>Support Root Cause Analysis of field return issues and implement additional test coverage as needed</li><li>Create documentation describing test design concepts and operator instructions</li><li>Experience related to manufacturing Printed Circuit Board Assemblies</li><li>Participate in peer reviews of test solutions</li><li>Skills:* Labview, C#, Test Stand, SQL, Manufacturing Test, Test Automation, Test development, Test design, Test procedure, Hardware, Debug, Test Fixture, Production, Manufacturing, Lab, Validation, Test plan, Test engineering, Electrical, Test equipment, Write test scripts</li><li>Top Skills Details:* Labview</li><li>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications:*</li><li>5+ years experience</li><li>Labview</li><li>Test Stand</li><li>C#</li><li>SQL or MySQL</li><li>Experience Level:* Intermediate Level</li></ul><p><br></p>About Actalent:<p><br></p>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

interpret test requirements and identify test equipment required to meet those requirements</li><li>Ability to identify, assess, and resolve hardware and software issues</li><li>Compile and interpret Gage R&amp;R and Cpk studies</li><li>Support Root Cause Analysis of field return issues and implement additional test coverage as needed</li><li>Create documentation describing test design concepts and operator instructions</li><li>Experience related to manufacturing Printed Circuit Board Assemblies</li><li>Participate in peer reviews of test solutions</li><li>Skills:* Labview, C#, Test Stand, Electrical, Test equipment, Write test scripts</li><li>Top Skills Details:* Labview</li><li>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications:*</li><li>5+ years experience</li><li>Labview</li><li>Test Stand</li><li>C#</li><li>SQL or MySQL</li><li>Experience Level:* Intermediate Level</li></ul><p><br></p>About Actalent:<p><br></p>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Test Engineer
description: <strong>Salary: $80k + $1,000/month MVA </strong><p><br></p><strong>Location: Downers Grove, IL</strong><p><br></p>We are looking for a Security Solutions Engineer to help support multiple locations. This position will be based in Downers Grove, IL; however, it may be necessary to travel to other offices or customer locations on an occasional basis. Some off hours work may be required.<p><br></p><ul><li>As a Security Solutions Engineer, you will be involved in the technical design, architecture, qualification and presentation of security solutions offered by Securitas. These include the integration of guarding services with access control, cameras, video analytics, remote monitoring services, intrusion detection, and alarm services. You will be required to work with customers to define their requirements, introduce specific technologies which meet those requirements, design, architect, and qualify proposed solutions, create Visio infrastructure topologies, proposals, and statements of work specific to the solutions to be offered and then present/review them with the customer.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We Offer:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, AD&amp;D and Disability Insurance, plus 401k options.</li><li>Discounts (Retail, Phone Plans, Rentals &amp; many more)</li><li>Employee Assistance Program &amp; much more!</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>Weekly Pay</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Essential Functions</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Must be able to research specific technology questions or topics and be comfortable with formal presentations or "chalk talks" of various technologies.</li><li>May be required to step into a project management role as needed.</li><li>Must work alongside the Technology Operations Management Team who will be responsible for the installation and maintenance of the sold systems.</li><li>Ability to pursue and achieve professional certifications will be required.</li><li>Interface with clients, AVPs, DMs, BDMs serving as the technical expert for security systems</li><li>Coordinate with field managers as needed to provide technology solutions (and information about such) to their clients and prospects</li><li>Attend client/prospect meetings to qualify, provide technology advice and information, present technology ideas, design and develop technology (service and equipment) solutions</li><li>Respond to bids and RFPs</li><li>Generate leads from existing clients and from new prospects</li><li>Manage leads and provide regular accounting of sales / prospect activity</li><li>Manage and report on sales and forecasting activity</li><li>Field calls from DMs, BDMs, AVPs and prospects regarding technology and systems</li><li>Create and present Integrated Guarding sales proposals (in conjunction with IGSC)</li><li>Use Google maps and Visio to create designs for the sales process</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Technical</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design and architect Security Systems</li><li>Provide scope of work and design documents</li><li>Use Google maps and Visio to create designs which are ready to handoff to engineers</li><li>Coordinate with Technology Project Ensure smooth hand-off for implementation</li><li>Work with Prospects and Technology Project Manager (as needed) to refine and define project scope prior to contract finalization </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>At least 2 years of previous experience in a project management role with a Value Added Reseller (VAR) and/or a Technology Manufacturer in the Security Systems Industry</li><li>At least 2 years technical experience with security systems including design and architecture</li><li>4 year college degree is preferred</li></ul><p><br></p>Come join our team and help make our world a safer place.<p><br></p>Apply online: https://ekaw.fa.us2.oraclecloud.com/hcmUI/CandidateExperience/en/sites/CX<p><br></p>See a different world.<p><br></p>IDFPR License #122-000899<p><br></p>EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabilities<p><br></p>#AF-NCSCHICILHP<p><br></p><strong>About Us</strong><p><br></p>Securitas employees come from all walks of life, bringing with them a variety of distinctive skills and perspectives. United through our common purpose, we provide the security needed to safeguard our clients' assets and people. Our core values - Integrity, Vigilance and Helpfulness - are represented by the three red dots in the Securitas logo. If you live by these values, we're looking for you to join the Securitas team.<p><br></p><strong>About The Team</strong><p><br></p>Our Company Mission:<p><br></p>Securitas' mission is to protect homes, workplaces, and communities by providing the security services they need to protect their assets, safeguard their people, and maintain their ability to generate profits.<p><br></p>Our Values:<p><br></p>Securitas' core values - Integrity, Vigilance and Helpfulness - are the foundation for our employees to build trust with customers, colleagues, and the surrounding community.<p><br></p>Integrity:<p><br></p>Securitas employees are honest and trusted by customers to safeguard their premises and valuables. We don't compromise on integrity and create an open forum for our employees and customers to voice opinions, report improprieties, and share information.<p><br></p>Vigilance:<p><br></p>Seeing, hearing, and evaluating. A Securitas employee is always attentive and often notices things that others don't. Their vigilance is necessary in order to be aware of potential risks or incidents that may take place on our customers' premises.<p><br></p>Helpfulness:<p><br></p>As part of an on-going effort to ensure safety, Securitas employees are always ready to help if an incident occurs that requires intervention regardless of whether or not it is directly related to their job.

title: Security Solutions Engineer
description: Software Guidance &amp; Assistance, Inc., (SGA), is searching for a Software Engineer for a CONTRACT assignment with one of our premier IT Services clients in Evanston, IL.<p><br></p>The Senior Software Consultant will perform full-stack development across the complete development life cycle delivering highly available cloud solutions and adding new capabilities to existing applications. Works with development teams and ensures the best practices are adhered to in areas such as unit and integration testing, CI/CD, documentation, security, and software design principals. This is an opportunity to join a forward-thinking industry leader that presents a multitude of opportunities. We are a diverse workforce dedicated to an inclusive environment. We are interested in technologists who want to grow their careers with LexisNexis Risk Solutions Company.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>Responsible for development of web-based enterprise applications from specifications<p><br></p>Responsible for staying current on advancements in technology, design practices, and architecture, as well as the latest software and networking processes, tools, and methods, and for making recommendations on how these advances can be applied to the current products and engineering practices.<p><br></p>Work in an Agile/Scrum SDLC<p><br></p><strong><u>Required</u></strong><p><br></p>Required Skills<p><br></p>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Related Major<p><br></p>Minimum of 8 years of related experience, including prior experience as a programmer in a commercial software development environment.<p><br></p>Strong experience with CI/CD pipelines with Jenkins or similar; Git/GitHub; Nexus, Artifactory, Docker<p><br></p>Experience in working in a cloud environment such as AWS, GCP or Azure.<p><br></p>Understanding of messaging systems like MQ, Rabbit MQ, Kafka, or Kinesis.<p><br></p>Expert-level development experience using Java, J2EE and Web applications using MVC model.<p><br></p>Experience with Web Services, Spring MVC, Struts. Hibernate, JPA and jQuery frameworks.<p><br></p>Experience integrating with Web Services (SOAP &amp; REST) and parsing JSON and XML data.<p><br></p>Experience designing and operating solutions with relational &amp; NoSQL Databases (SQL Server, Oracle, MongoDB)<p><br></p>Front end technologies &amp; AJAX Frameworks (Angular JS, Node.js, Java Script, HTML5, CSS)<p><br></p>Java, J2EE, Tomcat<p><br></p>Spring, Micro Services, Spring Boot, REST API, GraphQL, Hibernate<p><br></p>Elastic Search/Mongo DB, Oracle / SQL Server<p><br></p>Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, Web Services<p><br></p>XML, XSL, HTML, Java Script, Angular, AWS, Docker<p><br></p>SGA is a technology and resource solutions provider driven to stand out. We are a women-owned business. Our mission: to solve big IT problems with a more personal, boutique approach. Each year, we match consultants like you to more than 1,000 engagements. When we say let's work better together, we mean it. You'll join a diverse team built on these core values: customer service, employee development, and quality and integrity in everything we do. Be yourself, love what you do and find your passion at work. Please find us at .<p><br></p>EEO Employer: Race, Color, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, Religion, National Origin, Disability, Veteran Status, Age, Marital Status, Pregnancy, Genetic Information, or Other Legally Protected Status.

title: Principal, Application Security Engineer
description: <strong>Object Technology Solutions, Inc</strong> <strong>(OTSI)</strong> has an immediate opening for a SI integration Engineer<p><br></p>SI INTERGRATION ENGINEER – (ONSITE – SCHAUMBURG, IL)<p><br></p><strong>Major Responsibilites</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>System Integration of platforms, applications, end-to-end Telecom and IT systems </li><li>System Verification of solutions across labs, staging and production (live traffic) environments </li><li>Solution design and architecture </li><li>Scripting &amp; Automation of deployment and testing </li><li>Load testing of enterprise systems </li><li>Work on networking and data bases in a converged Telecom &amp; IT environment </li><li>Understanding the end-to-end solution </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Skills And Abilities Required</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Creating &amp; Innovating </li><li>Applying Expertise &amp; Technology </li><li>Analyzing </li><li>Learning &amp; Researching </li><li>Delivering Results &amp; Meeting Customer Expectations </li><li>Planning and organizing </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications And Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor or Master's degree or foreign equivalent in Electrical Engineering, Electronic Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, or related field </li><li>Domain / Technology / Knowledge </li><li>Value Added Services (VAS), Service Delivery Platforms (SDP) and Service Enablement (SE) </li><li>Open-source adaptations </li><li>API exposure </li><li>Data analysis </li><li>System integration experience </li><li>Linux/UNIX (install, configure) ADDITIONAL: SOAP, REST, TCP/IP, HTTP protocols knowledge </li><li>Networking knowledge (TCP/IP, switch config, IP troubleshooting – Snoop/Sniff/Packet analysis) </li><li>Scripting (shell/javascript/SQL) </li><li>Database knowledge (SQL, Oracle systems) </li><li>VMWare (experience working with VMWare ESXi, VSphere) </li><li>System Verification experience and use of tools (Selenium, SOAP UI, JMeter) </li><li>Work Experience on Troubleshooting Tools (WireShark, TOAD/SQL, WireMock, Tcpdump) </li><li>Focus areas of domain expertise </li><li>BSS (Real time and converged solutions, Billing, Portals, Campaign mgmt, EAI and CRM) </li><li>OSS (Fulfillment, Assurance, EAI, customer experience management) </li><li>Cloud </li><li>Service Delivery and Service Enablement solutions and VAS (Value added services) transformation/consolidation </li><li>TV &amp; Media </li><li>IP and network knowledge </li><li>Experience designing and implementing solutions in Oracle Service Bus and/or IBM Datapower </li><li>Able to perform deployments into dev, test, and production environment with appropriate test and post-change validation plans </li><li>Able to work with automation, build, and code management tools (Ansible, WLST/Python, Jenkins, GitHub) </li><li>Experience diagnosing and troubleshooting OSB and Weblogic deployments and connections to other common application stack services (Kafka, ODBC, WebServices) over both 1-way and 2-way SSL connections </li><li>Familiar with team documentation and task management tool (Wiki’s, Jira) </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Us</strong><p><br></p>OTSI is a leading global technology company offering solutions, consulting, and managed services for businesses worldwide since 1999. OTSI serves clients from its 15 offices across 6 countries around the globe with a “Follow-the-Sun” model. Headquartered in Overland Park, Kansas, we have a strong presence in North America, Central America, and Asia-Pacific with a Global Delivery Center based in India. These strategic locations offer our customers the competitive advantages of onshore, nearshore, and offshore engagement and delivery options, with 24/7 support. OTSI works with 100+ enterprise customers, of which many are Fortune ranked, OTSI focuses on industry segments such as Banking, Financial Services &amp; Insurance, Healthcare &amp; Life Sciences, Energy &amp; Utilities, Communications &amp; Media Entertainment, Engineering &amp; Telecom, Retail &amp; Consumer Services, Hi-tech, Manufacturing, Engineering, transport logistics, Government, Defense &amp; PSUs.<p><br></p><strong>Our Center Of Excellence</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Data &amp; Analytics</li><li> Digital Transformation</li><li> QA &amp; Automation</li><li> Enterprise Applications</li><li> Disruptive Technologies</li></ul>

title: Software Engineer
description: At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.<br><br>At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage, and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, but they're making history.<br><br>Northrop Grumman Space Systems designs, builds and delivers space, defense and aviation systems to customers around the world. Our main products include launch vehicles and associated propulsion systems; missile products, subsystems and defense electronics; precision weapons, armament systems and ammunition; satellites and associated space components and services; and advanced aerospace structures.<br><br>This position will be hired as a <strong> Staff Systems Engineer </strong> . This position is located at our <strong> Rolling Meadows, IL </strong> location within the greater Chicago metropolitan area. Opportunities are available in Systems Engineering Integration &amp; Test (SEIT) organization for the <strong>Systems Integration &amp; Test (I&amp;T) </strong>team. Tasking can include leading the integration &amp; testing of a space system, coordinate with various stakeholders, and present status to high-level leadership. Additional tasking may also include generation of test plans, test procedures, test automation, test reports, and execution of integration test activities in System Integration Labs (SILs) or offsite locations. I&amp;T provides a great opportunity to work alongside a variety of other Systems, Hardware, Software and Mechanical engineers to successfully execute on mission-critical programs.<br><br><strong> Sign-on bonus for available for eligible candidates who possess an ACTIVE TS/SCI clearance, and an additional sign-on bonus for eligible candidates who possess an active Polygraph. <br><br></strong><strong><u>Required Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> For Staff Systems Engineer , BS degree in Aerospace Engineering, Systems Engineering, or related technical degree with 14+ years (or MS with 12+ years; or PhD with 9+ years) related experience </li><li> Full life cycle experience developing, integrating, and deploying space systems </li><li> Experience creating integration &amp; test and design verification test plans and procedures </li><li> Experience performing system verification and validation </li><li> Working knowledge of one of more of the following specialty areas related to EOIR/RF systems: sensors/antennas, transmitters/receivers, optics, and associated lab equipment </li><li> Experience in Python, MATLAB, or other similar programming languages </li><li> Demonstrated proficiency in analytical thinking and problem-solving skills and Systems Thinking mindset </li><li> Excellent decision making and communication (written and oral) skills </li><li> Strong work ethic and the ability to work in an integrated product team (IPT) environment </li><li> Experience with interfacing with client and presenting technical data to the client </li><li> Experience with coordinating with multiple IPTs </li><li> Experience with investigating complex technical issues </li><li> Active or Current Top Secret Clearance is required to be considered </li><li> Must have the ability to obtain SCI level access </li></ul><strong> Preferred Qualifications: <br></strong><ul><li> Experience with Robot Framework, or other test automation frameworks </li><li> Experience with real-time signal processing </li><li> Working knowledge of DOORS </li><li> Familiar with orbital mechanics, dynamics and controls, rendezvous and proximity operations (RPO), orbit determination, and attitude planning </li><li> Familiar with Model Based Systems Engineering experience, especially in Cameo </li><li> Agile development experience a plus </li><li> Ability and willingness to travel </li><li> Active Top Secret Clearance with SCI &amp; polygraph is preferred </li></ul> <strong>Salary Range: </strong> $153,600 USD - $230,400 USD<br><br>Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.<br><br><strong>The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top priority</strong>. The company encourages employees to remain up-to-date on their COVID-19 vaccinations. U.S. Northrop Grumman employees may be required, in the future, to be vaccinated or have an approved disability/medical or religious accommodation, pursuant to future court decisions and/or government action on the currently stayed federal contractor vaccine mandate under Executive Order 14042 https://www.saferfederalworkforce.gov/contractors/ .<br><br>Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO . U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.
description_json: At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. title: Space TS/SCI - Staff Systems Engineer - Integration & Test (Up to $15K in sign-on bonus!)
description: <ul><li>Looking for a new HYBRID, DEVELOPMENT role? *</li><li>I have the one for you!* My client is currently hiring for a tenured Software Engineer who will be responsible for all phases of Embedded Software Development. This client creates products to provide communication, navigation, and guidance information to a Pilot. The Software Engineering team is responsible for producing the Avionics software embedded within these products as well as the production test environments for the products.</li></ul><p><br></p>Members of the software engineering team are responsible for all phases of embedded software development including: -Lifecycle of a SW product – start with some planning documents, gathering SW requirements, looking into things, allocate sw requirements – Code in C, integrate with systems work &amp; hw, waiting on HW, In this industry it’s a lot of paperwork along with coding.<p><br></p>This opportunity would require someone who is comfortable with the documentation side as there are a lot of standards.<p><br></p>Other duties:<p><br></p><ul><li>Writing software development plans</li><li>Documenting software requirements</li><li>Creating a software design</li><li>Writing software code</li><li>Writing software test cases and procedures</li><li>Skills:*</li><li>Embedded c</li><li>RTOS</li><li>C</li><li>C/C++</li><li>Aerospace</li><li>DO-178</li><li>DOORS Other beneficial experience to have:</li><li>DO-178C</li><li>ARINC 429</li><li>MIL-STD-1553</li><li>ARINC 653</li><li>OpenGL</li><li>DOORS</li><li>RTOS- various</li><li>Linux</li><li>Head Up Display</li><li>C++</li><li>Pilot license</li><li>Employee Perks:*</li><li>Paid Weekly</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plans</li><li>Abenity Discount Program</li><li>Udemy Courses</li><li>Work Life Balance</li><li>Experience Level:* 8+ years experience</li></ul><p><br></p>About Actalent:<p><br></p>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Microsoft Full Stack Engineer - Professional
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Direct Hire Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote - United States</li><li>SALARY: $125,000 – $160,000/yr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40hr/week - Long term</li><li>BRAINTRUST JOB ID: 6496<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements<br><br></strong><strong>Required Qualifications <br></strong><ul><li>5+ years technical software experience </li><li>Proficiency with fundamental front-end languages such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript</li><li>Proficiency with server-side languages such as PHP</li><li>Proficiency with database technology such as SQL Server and MySQL</li><li>Database design and management, including being up on the latest practices and associated versions</li><li>Strong understanding of software architecture, data structures, and computer science fundamentals </li><li>Strong security background (comfortable working with PII/sensitive data)</li><li>Experience with agile and fast-paced software development methodologies </li><li>Strong organizational, project management, and communication skills</li><li>Good problem-solving skills</li><li>Attention to detail<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Prior experience working and communicating directly with clients</li><li>Laravel and Node.js experience helpful</li><li>Familiarity with CSS preprocessors, bundlers, and associated languages/syntaxes/libraries (e.g., Sass, Less, and webpack)</li><li>An eye for design and user experience</li><li>Technical literacy and hands-on experience across the software stack, infrastructure, and dev-ops</li><li>Knowledge of Enterprise HR systems (WorkDay, SuccessFactors, Oracle, SAP)</li><li>Proficiency with Git</li><li>Appreciation for clean and well documented code</li></ul> <strong><strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong></strong>Full Stack Software Engineer, you will be working on the design, architecture, development, and innovation of customized HR software for some of the world’s most sophisticated companies. You will use PHP, SQL, JavaScript, and CSS to deploy software quickly to meet their needs. Our work is fast-paced, creative, and flexible–your days will be too! You will spend time problem solving with clients live, helping them see the range of what’s possible, building what they need, and working directly with HR experts. You will work alongside client team-members and thrive on the responsibility to own large projects from conceptualization to sunset.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Build the software development process from conception to deployment </li><li>Maintaining and upgrading the software following deployment </li><li>Managing the end-to-end life cycle for the production of software and applications </li><li>Modifying and testing changes to previously developed applications </li><li>Deliver high quality code in a fast and efficient manner </li><li>Must be fluent in all things PHP, MySQL, and Javascript </li><li>Develop front-end and back-end software using PHP/MySQL and HTML/Javascript/CSS with Vue.js or React.js </li><li>Identify and mitigate end-to-end security concerns </li><li>Ensuring the entire stack is designed and built for speed and scalability </li><li>Mentoring other engineers </li><li>Work across the organization to foster a culture of architecture that allows for iterative, autonomous development and future scaling. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Microsoft Full Stack Engineer
description: Job Overview:<p><br></p>We are looking for someone that works hard and is experienced to join our staff on 1st shift. Pay is entirely based on experience. In exchange for your hard work, we offer excellent benefits including medical/dental/vision, 401K with company match, paid holidays, vacation, flexible spending, and much more!<p><br></p>As a CNC Mill Programmer, you will write programs and modify existing ones for our Kitamura &amp; Hwacheon Mills in MasterCam (we will train for PowerMill). Our millss have Fanuc controls.<p><br></p>You'll need to be able to set up, operate and program a CNC Mill, know how to use machinist tools for measuring and indicating workpieces, be able to read and interpret blueprints, and have a mathematical aptitude.<p><br></p>Other qualifications include being able to use various hand tools, being able to work on your own without much supervision, being able to finish setup sheets, and possessing computer skills in order to transfer program files to the appropriate workstation.<p><br></p>We are looking for someone that is self-motivated, organized, and can work well with others as well as work well independently.<p><br></p>Overall, this is a great opportunity to join an organization that prides itself on offering great wages, great benefits, and excellent opportunities to grow professionally!<p><br></p>You should be proficient in:<p><br></p><ul><li>Tool/Die/Mold Repair Skills</li><li>Tool/Die/Mold Setup Experience</li><li>Troubleshooting CNC Machines</li><li>Shop Math Skills</li></ul><p><br></p>Machines &amp; technologies you'll use:<p><br></p><ul><li>CNC Mill (3-4 axis VMC) (Fanuc)<br><br></li></ul> ID:yUx7fb Ref #: 31309

title: Microsoft Full Stack Engineer
description: <ul><li>Coordinate with team to help define the future of the product|.NET/Azure/JavaScript greenfield projects<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>Financial technology company that is revolutionizing the way investment professionals consume information for their private investments and is proprietary of a software platform which modernizes information flow for hedge funds and asset managers by connecting investment professionals to market moving news and financial data.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><ul><li>Coordinate with senior technical leadership to solve problems</li><li>Coordinate with team to help define the future of the product</li><li>Collaborate to define and implement new features</li><li>Support both front-end and back-end application layers</li><li>Manage cloud infrastructure and deployments</li><li>Build integrations with external technology vendors and partners</li><li>Translate requirements into a rich user experience</li><li>Proactively identify areas of improvement and suggest enhancements</li><li>Establish and evolve patterns and practices<br><br></li></ul><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong><ul><li>Individual must demonstrate passion, tenacity, and strong desire to make an impact in building an organization</li><li>Full-stack (web, API, database) development experience</li><li>4+ years of building products on Azure</li><li>4+ years of building JavaScript web applications with the following:</li><li>React, Redux, and TypeScript preferred</li><li>4+ years of building server-side applications with the following:</li><li>ASP.NET Core Web APIs in C#</li><li>Basic knowledge of accounting and finance strongly preferred<br><br></li></ul><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><strong>What's On Offer<br><br></strong>Up to 150k, base salary + competitive benefits<br><br>Work Location: Hybrid in Chicago (River North) 2 days in office scheme<br><br><strong>Contact: Daniela Rodríguez Flores<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-062023-6083870</strong>

title: CNC Mill Programmer
description: If you are a current Chamberlain Group employee, please click here to apply through your Workday account.<p><br></p>This role is responsible for applying basic knowledge to the design and development of embedded applications on hardware platforms. The focus in this role includes creation of technical specifications, application firmware design and development, and support for manufacturing and regulatory approval. Knowledge of basic software development practices and principles is required. An Engineer 2, Firmware must support their peers in day-to-day development activities and be able to troubleshoot platform defects of limited complexity. This role will be responsible for both individual and team based software development activities<p><br></p>Job Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Design, develop, and implement application level firmware solutions to meet business needs</li><li>Work with stakeholders to understand functional requirements of systems to accurately develop designs, implementations and test cases</li><li>Design and develop application firmware using best practices that adhere to product specifications using an Agile development process</li><li>Create and maintain technical specifications as related to product development</li><li>Work with senior engineers to implement scalable designs and modular functional blocks that meet product requirements</li><li>Use design analysis techniques such as FMEA or rate monotonic analysis to validate software designs prior to implementation. Ability to accurately document an intended design is critical</li><li>Create unit test cases that accurately test interface functionality and responses to varied inputs both in and out of scope</li><li>Analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve firmware defects as found during bench, lab, and production QA testing</li><li>Apply software quality tools such as Lint, Understand, and other static and dynamic analysis tools to verify software releases meet quality and coding standards</li><li>Support regulatory engineering for FCC and other outside agency approval of end products</li><li>Support manufacturing on site during as needed for engineering and production builds</li><li>Manage own work to deliver according to project schedules; be accountable for delivery</li><li>Actively contribute to the adoption of software architecture, best practices, and technologies</li><li>Responsible for complying with the security requirements set forth by the Information Security team and the established ISO 27001 Security Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities Document found in the ISMS Document Library</li><li>Comply with health and safety guidelines and rules; managers should also ensure compliance across their teams</li><li>Protect Chamberlain Group’s reputation by keeping information confidential</li><li>Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reading professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies</li><li>Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing related results and participating on projects as needed</li></ul><p><br></p>Job Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in computer engineering, computer science, electrical engineering, related technical field or equivalent practical experience</li><li>An advanced degree in directly applicable area of study may substitute for up to two (2) years of experience</li><li>1+ years of job-related experience as defined in the Essential Duties and Responsibilities</li><li>Able to travel up to 10% - domestically and internationally</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred Job Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to work within cross functional teams to create electro-mechanical products; strong analytical skills; effective communication skills; Oriented programming experience; TCP, UPD, HTTP, WebSockets, MQTT, or other connected protocols</li><li>Agile/Scrum experience</li></ul><p><br></p>We're an organization who values its human capital and provides support to assist its employees succeed.<p><br></p>Chamberlain Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. You will be considered for this position based upon your experience and education, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, ancestry; marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discriminations or harassment.<p><br></p>Persons with disabilities who anticipate needing accommodations for any part of the application process may contact, in confidence Recruiting@Chamberlain.com.<p><br></p>NOTE: Staffing agencies, headhunters, recruiters, and/or placement agencies, please do not contact our hiring managers via email or phone or other methods.

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description: Will work remote temporarily but will might need to come into Willis for required meetings. Needs to be local to the client site.<p><br></p><strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>:" Design, develop, document, unit test, and debug new Cloud applications utilizing JSON, Java, existing software systems, and large-scale proprietary Cloud backend with EC2, DynamoDB, Microservices, etc. for internal use.<p><br></p>" Serve as a technical expert on development projects.<p><br></p>" Participate in full development life cycle including requirements analysis and design.<p><br></p>" Write technical specifications based on conceptual design and stated business requirements.<p><br></p>" Support, maintain, and document software functionality.<p><br></p>" Identify and evaluate new technologies for implementation.<p><br></p>" Analyze code to find causes of cyber security vulnerable errors and revise programs as needed.<p><br></p>" Participate in software design meetings and analyze user needs to determine technical requirements.<p><br></p>" Consult with end-users to prototype, refine, test, and debug programs to meet needs.<p><br></p>" Career-development position within the field.<p><br></p>" Requires high skill sets and developing proficiency within the discipline.<p><br></p>" Conducts tasks and assignments as directed.<p><br></p>" Works under no or minimum supervision with some latitude for independent judgment.<p><br></p>" Typically requires 5-8 years of relevant experience or equivalent combination of experience and education.<p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>" Angular, Node.js, TypeScript, Bootstrap, SCSS, Node.js, npm<p><br></p>" Microservices Development: Java, Spring Integration, Spring Boot, XML, XSD, Spring Kafka, Apache CXF, Restful API, Docker, Kubernetes, FluentD, Prometheus, Helm<p><br></p>" AWS Stack: AWS Amplify CLI, ElasticSearch, AppSynch<p><br></p><strong><u>Education</u></strong><p><br></p>" Bachelors degree in Computer Science required<p><br></p>" Java/AWS certificate preferred<p><br></p><strong><u>Hiring Manager Notes</u></strong><p><br></p>" Position is needed to backfill lead developer role for Baggage Systems<p><br></p>" Will work on web-based AWS, back-end services, analytics, and DB services, which requires full-stack developers in Java, AWS, etc.

title: Hybrid- Software Engineering (.Net/C#)
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>As a <strong>Senior Associate Application Engineer (Full Stack),</strong> you<strong>’</strong>ll build and release reliable software systems at scale. By partnering with enterprise-wide) teams, you’ll develop and maintain full stack solutions that fit our business needs. You’ll use your holistic view of all products (and their interactions) to design elegant solutions and strategize the future state of our larger technical ecosystem. By independently innovating and advocating for best practices, you’ll solve complex problems and guide the team on implementing solutions from inception to production.<p><br></p>In this specific role, you will be part of a product team responsible for the technical development in the Bank Collections department. Each product team is responsible for new business features as well as a strong focus on application modernization and building out the CI/CD pipeline for the Discover bank collections platform (E-ICE).<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Completes most features and user stories including test cases and automation unattended</li><li>Learns more complex software engineering practices such as domain driven design, test driven development, operations, and security</li><li>Contributes to agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms, and participates in technology communities</li><li>Participates in system design decisions and learns how these decisions impact the product as a whole</li><li>Learns to support production systems and understands how observed events and failures impact the product</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related</li><li>1+ Years – Information Technology, (Software) Engineering, or related</li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of advanced beginner on the Dreyfus engineering scale</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><ul><li>Either hands on experience or ability to quickly learn and adapt to our tech stack</li><ul><li>Java/JavaScript programming</li><li>Eclipse RCP or Java Swing</li><li>Cloud Technology – AWS, Pivotal Cloud Foundry, OpenShift</li><li>Extreme automation mindset as it pertains to testing and build/deploy concepts</li><li>CI/CD Pipeline experience via Jenkins, Github Actions, Chef, Ansible, Nexus</li></ul><li>Knowledge of the banking industry a plus</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $70,000.00 to $118,400.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>

title: Tandem Developer - TANDEM, COBOL, SCOBOL
description: *Hybrid, 3 days onsite, 2 days remote*<p><br></p>A prestigious financial firm needs a Java Streaming Developer Contractor. This role is focused on Java 8+ development experience, streaming using Kafka, Multithreading, API, Microservices, and knowledge of DevOps, Terraform, Ansible, AWS, etc.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Primarily responsibility is application development following API driven micro-services and micro-applications architecture for given business requirements adhering agile SDLC.</li><li>Analyzes requirements, develops, tests, and documents software quality to ensure proper implementation.</li><li>Follows agreed upon SDLC procedures to ensure that all information system products and services meet: both explicit and implicit quality standards, end-user functional requirements, architectural standards, performance requirements, audit requirements, security rules are upheld, and external facing reporting is properly represented.</li><li>Application and project risk analysis and recommends quality improvements.</li><li>Providing advice on system functionality and fixes as required</li><li>Experience with resolving security vulnerabilities</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Java 8+ experience required, including deep understanding of Java fundamentals as Memory Model, Runtime Environment,</li><li>Concurrency and Multithreading.</li><li>Good knowledge of kafka</li><li>Good knowledge of Java persistence layers and SQLs</li><li>Working knowledge of DevOps tools. Eg Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Helm and CI/CD pipeline etc.</li><li>Deep knowledge of RESTful standards and practices</li><li>Experience in computer algorithms and data structures, including ability to articulate and apply in practice different type of sorting, hashing, partitioning, and search operations.</li><li>Ability to identify both time and memory complexity for the written code.</li></ul>

title: Firmware Engineer II
description: <ul><li>Work with a fast-growing software company and a collaborative team|Work on greenfield projects and cutting edge new developments.<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>Our client is an industry leader in the youth sports and athletics industry, and this role is located in an northern Chicago suburb. Since this is an urgent hire, they have a fairly "quick" interviewing process to fill this position.<br><br><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><ul><li>Write correct and clean code; consistently upholds &amp; exemplifies stated best practices.</li><li>Participate actively in the design of new technical features.</li><li>Learn quickly and make daily progress without the need for constant, significant feedback from more senior engineers.</li><li>Know when to ask for help in order to maximize work flow and if needed get unblocked.</li><li>Able to take ownership of small-to-medium features from technical design through completion.</li><li>Be capable of prioritizing tasks while avoiding getting caught up in insignificant details.</li><li>Ability to become self-sufficient in an area of the system with a high-level understanding of other components.</li><li>Capable of providing support for their system/platform area, including systems that they are not familiar with.<br><br></li></ul><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree or above in Computer Science or related field</li><li>At least 10+ years of experience as a Software Developer / Engineer</li><li>Strong experience with Java and C#/ .NET</li><li>Development experience Spring framework, Angular, React.</li><li>Ability to work in a fast paced environment<br><br></li></ul><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><strong>What's On Offer<br><br></strong><ul><li>Top of the market salary, ranging from $115k-$160k based upon experience</li><li>Excellent total comp package with benefits</li><li>401k match, and Health care / Medical Insurances</li><li>Very generous PTO, sick, mental and holiday time-off<br><br></li></ul><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong>Please feel free to email your updated resume and a summary of your relevant experience to JordanKurth @ MichaelPage.US.com<br><br><strong>Contact: Jordan Kurth<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-062023-6083767</strong>
