title: Java Developer III
description: At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.<br><br>At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.<br><br>Northrop Grumman Space Systems designs, builds and delivers space, defense and aviation-related systems to customers around the world. Our main products include launch vehicles and related propulsion systems; missile products, subsystems and defense electronics; precision weapons, armament systems and ammunition; satellites and associated space components and services; and advanced aerospace structures.<br><br>Our Systems Engineering Integration &amp; Test (SEIT) organization, within Payload &amp; Ground Systems Division (PGSD), provides complex subsystems and defense electronics. This position can be hired as a Sr. Principal Systems Engineer in either of the following 2 disciplines: (1) Systems Design or (2) Modelling &amp; Simulation.<br><br>This position is located at our Rolling Meadows, IL location.<br><br>As a part of the SEIT team, a Systems Design engineer is exposed to the front end Systems Engineering process and coordinates across many disciplines to ensure that the system description and requirements are properly and thoroughly defined, captured, and meet the mission need for the end customer.<br><br><strong><u>Tasking For Systems Design Can Include<br></u></strong><ul><li>Performing key systems engineering elements to meet a given program's requirements</li><li>Supporting the design and development of sensor system architectures</li><li>Performing functional analysis, timeline analysis, detailed trade studies, requirements allocation, and interface definition studies to translate customer requirements into hardware and software specifications</li><li>Responsibility for close customer cooperation to ensure that requirements meet customer expectations</li><li>Providing presentations to customers and senior management, with tailored material based on the audience</li><li>Leading / overseeing technical work products developed by the larger engineering team, supporting design reviews and integration and test activities as needed</li><li>creating and refining Model Based System Engineering products (System behavioral models, Use Case realizations, State Machines, etc.)</li><li>generation and update of specifications in DOORS, including requirements traceability and dxl script development</li><li>capability assessments to predict requirement compliance</li><li>functional algorithm development</li><li>risk assessment and burn down of mitigation steps</li><li>generating and reporting system Technical Performance Measures</li><li>Interface development and documentation</li></ul>As part of the SEIT team, a Modeling &amp; Simulation Engineer is exposed to the full life-cycle of Systems Engineering process and coordinates across many disciplines to ensure that the system is modeled with sufficient fidelity. In the early stages of programs, modeling &amp; simulation is leveraged to understand system CONOPs, inform system architecture, and perform trades. In the later stages as the design matures, field test data is used to verify and validate the models and ensure the payload models are representative of actual performance.<br><br><strong><u>Tasking For Modelling And Simulation Can Include<br></u></strong><ul><li>Providing physics level and mission level modeling subject matter expertise</li><li>Leading a team of modelling and simulation engineers to define study scope and guide independent research and development activities.</li><li>Supporting capture activities, including RFI/RFP preparation, customer presentations and live demonstrations, and competitor analysis</li><li>Software development of physics-based in-house models and algorithms</li><li>Perform analysis and trades of product line architectures using analytical models and mission level simulations</li><li>Functional algorithm development</li><li>Authoring technical documentation such as white papers, proposal technical volumes, program milestone briefings (i.e. SRR, PDR, CDR,...), systems engineering design documentation</li><li>Presenting technical analysis to multiple stakeholders</li><li>Creating and refining Model Based Systems Engineering Products (System behavioral models, Use Case realizations, State Machines, etc.)</li></ul>In addition, the ideal candidate has recent experience in the fields of either EOIR, RF systems, or both. Specifically, the ideal candidate will have experience in the following specialties.<br><ul><li>Advanced knowledge and recent experience in one or more of the following areas: EOIR/RF systems: sensors/antennas, transmitters/receivers, lasers, LiDAR, optics, visible and IR cameras, focal plane arrays.</li><li>Real-time signal processing</li><li>Requirements analysis and allocation as related to Systems Engineering</li></ul><strong> Additional $10k sign-on bonus for selected candidates who possess an ACTIVE TS/SCI clearance, and an additional $5k sign-on bonuses to selected candidates who possess an active Polygraph. <br><br></strong><strong><u>Basic Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree with 9 years of experience, a Master's degree with 7 years of experience or a Ph.D. with 4 years of experience in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Physics, Applied Mathematics, or related technical fields.</li><li>Theoretical knowledge of the System Engineering V-Model and hands on experience executing the systems engineering work flow </li><li>Demonstrated analytical thinking, problem solving skills, and creativity</li><li>Excellent decision making and communication (written and oral) skills</li><li>Team players with a strong work ethic and initiative to perform in a cross functional team</li><li>Ability to obtain Top Secret/SCI level accesses</li></ul><strong> Preferred Qualifications: <br></strong><ul><li>Active Top Secret Clearance with SCI &amp; polygraph is preferred</li><li>Working knowledge of RF sensors/antennas, transmitters/receivers </li><li>Experience with real-time signal processing in both firmware and software</li><li>Advanced knowledge of orbital mechanics, dynamics and controls, rendezvous and proximity operations (RPO), orbit determination, and attitude planning</li><li>Knowledgeable in orbit planning in LEO, GEO and cislunar regimes</li><li>Knowledgeable in the use of COTS tools such as AGI's Systems Tool Kit (STK) and Orbital Determination Tool Kit (ODTK)</li><li>Full life cycle experience developing, integrating, and deploying space systems</li><li>Knowledgeable in space systems design and mission planning</li><li>Experience in specification development and requirements derivation using DOORS</li><li>Experience deploying innovative modeling methods for Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) using tools like Cameo</li><li>Knowledge of MATLAB, SysML, Python, or other scripting languages</li><li>Recent experience creating integration and test, design verification test and flight test plans and procedures</li><li>Ability and willingness to travel up to 15%</li><li>Experience working in an Agile environment</li><li>CompTIA Security+ Certification</li><li>Experience as a system administrator, security engineer, Information Systems Security Officer (ISSO), or other role supporting a system Authorization to Operate (ATO)</li></ul> <strong>Salary Range: </strong> $123,800 USD - $185,800 USD<br><br>Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.<br><br><strong>The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top priority</strong>. The company encourages employees to remain up-to-date on their COVID-19 vaccinations. U.S. Northrop Grumman employees may be required, in the future, to be vaccinated or have an approved disability/medical or religious accommodation, pursuant to future court decisions and/or government action on the currently stayed federal contractor vaccine mandate under Executive Order 14042 https://www.saferfederalworkforce.gov/contractors/ .<br><br>Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO . U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

title: Senior Associate Software Developer (Full Stack)
description: <ul><li>Onsite client location Monday through Friday</li><li>Consultant with enhanced benefits</li><li>Job Description: *</li><li>Design and develop C# .NET based embedded software through the full SDLC</li><li>Implement applications that run on the Linux OS</li><li>Write software design specifications</li><li>Participate in peer source code and design reviews</li><li>Mentor junior level engineers</li><li>Assume an Onsite Coordinator role within the project by facilitating communication between Client and Actalent Offshore Team, coordinate with Client stakeholders to understand requirements and architecture, and clarifying validation failures to Actalent Offshore Team</li><li>This role will serve as an escalation point for technical and customer issues that may arise</li><li>Collaborate with the Project Manager on the quality and timeliness of the deliverable to ensure compliance to Quality Management System processes.</li><li>Note: this role will not have any direct employee reports and is approximately 75% hands on, performing software design, development, and testing.</li><li>Skills:* C#, .NET, embedded system, Linux, java</li><li>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications:* Minimum Qualifications:</li><li>BS/MS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or Computer Science and at least 5 years of experience as a Software Engineer/Developer</li><li>Experience leading engineers including training, mentorship, clarification of requirements and architecture</li><li>Experience planning and delegating tasks based on evaluation of capability with a project team</li><li>Experience with the full SDLC using the C# programming language, OOP architecture, and .NET framework</li><li>Ability to read Java code</li><li>Experience with Linux based embedded software</li><li>Ability to create supporting documentation such as design documents, architecture diagrams, test procedures and reports.</li><li>Good oral and written communication skills with the ability to professionally support periodic communication to management and technical teams</li><li>Experience with Agile Scrum development methodologies and common workflow tools: GIT, Jira, etc Desired Qualifications</li><li>Understanding of REST APIs</li><li>Experience designing software for a distributed network for CAN or Ethernet communication</li><li>Experience designing software for display systems and closed loop control systems</li><li>Experience with common debugging tools such as oscilloscopes, network analyzer, emulators</li><li>Experience Level:* Expert Level</li></ul><p><br></p>About Actalent:<p><br></p>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

Qualifications:* Minimum Qualifications:</li><li>BS/MS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or Computer Science and at least 5 years of experience as a Software Engineer/Developer</li><li>Experience leading engineers including training, mentorship, clarification of requirements and architecture</li><li>Experience planning and delegating tasks based on evaluation of capability with a project team</li><li>Experience with the full SDLC using the C# programming language, OOP architecture, and .NET framework</li><li>Ability to read Java code</li><li>Experience with Linux based embedded software</li><li>Ability to create supporting documentation such as design documents, architecture diagrams, test procedures and reports.</li><li>Good oral and written communication skills with the ability to professionally support periodic communication to management and technical teams</li><li>Experience with Agile Scrum development methodologies and common workflow tools: GIT, Jira, etc Desired Qualifications</li><li>Understanding of REST APIs</li><li>Experience designing software for a distributed network for CAN or Ethernet communication</li><li>Experience designing software for display systems and closed loop control systems</li><li>Experience with common debugging tools such as oscilloscopes, network analyzer, emulators</li><li>Experience Level:* Expert Level</li></ul><p><br></p>About Actalent:<p><br></p>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Java Streaming Developer Consultant
description: CNH Industrial is a world-class equipment and services company dedicated to advancing the noble work of agriculture and construction workers. Driven by our shared purpose of Breaking New Ground, we are passionate about bringing Innovation, Sustainability, and Productivity to all that we do. As a truly global company, CNH Industrial’s 37,000+ employees form part of a diverse and inclusive workplace, focused on empowering customers to grow, and build, a better world through our core brands: Case IH, STEYR, New Holland Agriculture, CASE, and New Holland Construction.<p><br></p>In Precision Technology, we make iron smarter. Our team members deliver innovative solutions helping our customers to be more productive, save time, lower costs, and to operate sustainably. From vehicle displays, application controls, steering solutions, digital services and telematics, to fully autonomous driverless technology, we develop solutions that solve challenges for customers around the world.<p><br></p>Design, develop, and evaluate software for embedded systems from concept through production stage, and make modifications as needed.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>Duties: The Embedded Software Engineer at CNH Industrial America LLC in Burr Ridge, IL will be responsible for developing software for CNH Industrial’s onboard Electronics Control Units (ECUs) for Precision Agriculture and Construction Equipment products; developing middleware infrastructure software components such as communication stacks and power management stacks for the onboard controllers; participating in system and software vehicle architecture reviews and providing mentorship for junior developers; designing, developing, testing, debugging and implementing operating systems components, software tools, and utilities using best practice software development processes and code; determining systems software design requirements; conferring with management, production, and marketing staff to determine engineering feasibility, cost effectiveness, and customer demand for new and existing software products; coordinating field testing of software products and systems; communicating with vehicle platforms to provide regular updates of software development activities and progress; documenting and demonstrating solutions by developing documentation, flowcharts, and diagrams to support problem analysis; developing clear and concise well-structured and documented source code applicable for software re-use across multiple controllers; participating in requirements, design, and source code reviews; maintaining released code, as needed; and identifying and implementing opportunities for software process and development cycle time improvements. May telecommute up to three days a week. Salary: $132,710 - $ 163,300 /year.<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>Minimum Requirements: Requires a Bachelor's degree in Electrical or Electronic Engineering or closely related field plus five years of embedded system development experience. The five years of experience must include five years of experience with each of the following: 1) working on software applications to support the development of platform and core software; 2) C, C++ for drivers, middleware, application development; 3) designing, developing, testing and implementing operating system components, software tools and utilities; 4) defining system software design requirements; 5) coordinating field testing of software products and systems; 6) maintaining code and releases and developing structured document source code for re-use across other controllers; 7) identifying and implementing software process and development cycle time improvements.<p><br></p>CNH Industrial America LLC' s ongoing employee referral program does apply to this position.<p><br></p>Interested candidates should apply online at http://cnhindustrial.com/<p><br></p>CNH Industrial offers a wide variety of benefits that not only encourages wellness and preventative care, but we also provide the right tools and programs to help you achieve it. Our benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. Our industry leading 401k will support you in meeting your retirement objectives. Additional benefits include paid parental leave, flexible work policies, opportunities for self-development and paid leave for specific activities. Click here for more information!<p><br></p><strong> EEO </strong><p><br></p>US applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster and its supplement here . CNH Industrial participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. You can view additional information here.<p><br></p>If you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at narecruitingmailbox@cnhind.com.<p><br></p>Read about our company’s commitment to pay transparency by clicking this link: pay transparency notice .<p><br></p>Canada applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, nationality, place of origin, disability, marital status, family status, age, or any other ground prohibited by applicable provincial human rights legislation.

title: C#/.NET Software Engineer - Chicago
description: <strong>Job Locations <br><br></strong>US-IL-Lisle<br><br><strong> Your Opportunity <br><br></strong>The Supply Chain Finance team is seeking out driven, detail-oriented professionals to exercise GAAP principles while preserving the superior financial standing of our company. These personnel examine financial data for accurate costing, trends and opportunities, and performance against target. The Analyst will be responsible for analysis within the functional areas of the supply chain, including transportation, warehouse and inventory planning related transactions.<br><br><strong> Salary Range <br><br></strong>$54,000 - $90,500<br><br><strong><u>Core Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Prepare, review and distribute monthly financial reports for the transportation and warehousing division of Smithfield Foods. </li><li> Determines cost of operations by establishing standard costs; collecting operational data. </li><li> Identifies financial status by comparing and analyzing actual results with plan and forecast. </li><li> Guides cost analysis process by establishing and enforcing policies and procedures; providing trends; explaining processes and techniques; recommending actions. </li><li> Recommends actions by analyzing and interpreting data and making comparative analyses; studying proposed changes in methods. </li><li> Responsible for month-end, quarter-end and year-end close for assigned functional areas. </li><li> Protects operations by keeping financial information confidential. </li><li> Assist in developing management reports through functional knowledge of our ERP system, including the following: SAP BI, SAP BPC &amp; SAP General Ledger, as well as our transportation system. </li><li> Prepare ad-hoc reports and potential assignment to special studies/teams to assist management in evaluating key opportunities for the company. </li><li> Compliance with all Sarbanes-Oxley internal reporting requirements. <br></li></ul>The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. May perform other duties as assigned.<br><br><strong><u>Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals to perform the essential functions .<br><ul><li> Bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited four-year college or university in Accounting, Finance or Economics and 2+ years’ experience in reporting, consolidation and financial analysis; or equivalent combination of education and experience . </li><li> Prior accounting/GAAP knowledge. </li><li> Experience in CPG industry is a plus. </li><li> Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office (emphasis on Excel &amp; Access). </li><li> Knowledge of data analytics systems and reporting functionality is a plus. </li><li> Strong initiative and ability to manage multiple projects. </li><li> Excellent written and verbal communication skills. </li><li> Strong initiative and ability to manage multiple projects as well as strong follow through skills. </li><li> Ability to complete projects timely and accurately critical. </li><li> Must be detail oriented with strong organizational and analytical skills. </li><li> Ability to work well with others in fast paced, dynamic environment. </li><li> Ability to be respectful, approachable and team oriented while building strong working relationships and a positive work environment.</li></ul>

title: Space TS/SCI - Senior Principal Engineer Systems (Up to $15k in sign-on bonus for eligible candidates!)
description: Summary Accenture Flex offers you the flexibility of local fixed-duration project-based work powered by Accenture, a leading global professional services company. Accenture is consistently recognized on FORTUNE's 100 Best Companies to Work For and Diversity Inc's Top 50 Companies For Diversity lists.As an Accenture Flex employee, you will apply your skills and experience to help drive business transformation for leading organizations and communities. In addition to delivering innovative solutions for Accenture's clients, you will work with a highly skilled, diverse network of people across Accenture businesses who are using the latest emerging technologies to address today's biggest business challenges.You will receive competitive rewards and access to benefits programs and world-class learning resources. Accenture Flex employees work in their local metro area onsite at the project, significantly reducing and/or eliminating the demands to travel.Job Responsibilities:Collaborate with team members, leaders, and stakeholders.New Development of cutting edge Java Applications. Qualifications Basic Qualifications:Minimum of 4 years' experience in Core Java DevelopmentMinimum of 4 years' experience building secure, highly available, resilient, scalable systems leveraging clustering and load balancing of web / app servers and messaging systems (Kafka / MQ Series)Minimum of 4 years' experience container-based development, orchestration, micro services frameworks and tools (Docker, Kubernetes, Spring Boot, Swagger)Minimum of 4 years' experience with Agile methodology and leveraging SDLC tools to improve development and testing efficiency (JIRA, Jenkins, GIT, JUnit, Selenium, Lint)Must be able to pass client background check/onboarding requirementMust be able to work on client site 3 days/weekHigh School Diploma or GEDCompensation at Accenture varies depending on a wide array of factors, which may include but are not limited to the specific office location, role, skill set, and level of experience. As required by local law, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in Albany County, NY, California, Colorado, New York City or Washington as set forth below.Information on benefits is here.Role LocationCalifornia - $67.30 to $77.30/hourColorado - $67.30 to $77.30/hourNew York - Albany - $67.30 to $77.30/hourNew York City - $67.30 to $77.30/hourWashington - $67.30 to $77.30/hour What We Believe We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Read more here Equal Employment Opportunity StatementAccenture is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation.All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.For details, view a copy of the Accenture Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Policy Statement.Requesting An AccommodationAccenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired.If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with Accenture and have accommodation needs for a disability or religious observance, please call us toll free at 1 (877) 889-9009, send us an email or speak with your recruiter.Other Employment StatementsApplicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States.Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Company's legal duty to furnish information.PDN-99518116-5b13-4c6a-a164-9fc79f16a4c3

title: Software Engineer
description: CNH Industrial is a world-class equipment and services company dedicated to advancing the noble work of agriculture and construction workers. Driven by our shared purpose of Breaking New Ground, we are passionate about bringing Innovation, Sustainability, and Productivity to all that we do. As a truly global company, CNH Industrial’s 37,000+ employees form part of a diverse and inclusive workplace, focused on empowering customers to grow, and build, a better world through our core brands: Case IH, STEYR, New Holland Agriculture, CASE, and New Holland Construction.<p><br></p>In Precision Technology, we make iron smarter. Our team members deliver innovative solutions helping our customers to be more productive, save time, lower costs, and to operate sustainably. From vehicle displays, application controls, steering solutions, digital services and telematics, to fully autonomous driverless technology, we develop solutions that solve challenges for customers around the world.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>As an <strong>Embedded Software Engineer for Auto Guidance applications, </strong>you will become a contributing member of a team, focused on the development of Auto Guidance and GNSS embedded software applications that run on CNHi’s next-generation embedded controllers. The software you create will control various functions of CNHi tractors, sprayers, and harvesters and enable a wide range of Auto guidance features.<p><br><br></p><ul><li>Design, develop, test, and debug software components used for electronically controlled systems on various Agriculture &amp; Forestry products while working within a defined development framework and coding standards</li><li>Participate within a SAFe Agile-based software development team and collaborate with cross-functional product design teams developing various Precision Agriculture features</li><li>Participate in SAFe Agile daily standups, Sprint/PI Planning, Sprint Demos, Retros, and other Sprint Events</li><li>Utilize software tools and electronic instruments to troubleshoot and debug embedded system<br></li></ul><p><br></p>This role pays-$101,000-$146,000 plus any applicable bonus (Actual salaries will vary and will be based on various factors , such as skill, experience and qualification for the role.)<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br><br></p><ul><li>Engineer with 2+ years of career experience, with Bachelors' degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering. 1+ years’ experience with master’s degree. Or equivalent combination of education and experience.</li><li>2+ years of experience designing &amp; developing embedded / electronic systems from concept to release</li><li>Experience in Electrical and/or Software Engineering performing analysis, design, and testing for embedded software projects</li><li>Experience with Embedded C, C++ programming languages<br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br><br></p><ul><li>Experience Model Based Software Design, preferably MathWorks (Simulink/Stateflow/Real-Time Workshop)</li><li>Understanding of Automotive networking protocols such as CAN, J1939</li><li>Experience with embedded systems tools such as compilers, debuggers, simulators, etc.</li><li>Experience with software versioning, repository management, and package management tools</li><li>Experience with continuous integration development, using automated build and test practices</li><li>Experience in embedded systems design with preemptive, multitasking real-time operating systems</li><li>Experience in Embedded Software Development for mobile equipment applications</li><li>Experience with Electro-Hydraulic or vehicle control systems for on/off-highway vehicle systems</li><li>Experience with automated testing (LABview, CAPL, etc)</li><li>Team player who is self-motivated and can work with minimal supervision</li><li>Familiarity with Agile development, Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), or similar methodologies</li><li>Familiarity with Java programming language</li><li>Prior experience with Linux OS (Ubuntu)<br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Company Benefits</strong><p><br></p>CNH Industrial offers a wide variety of benefits that not only encourages wellness and preventive care, but we also provide the right tools and programs to help you achieve it. Our benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. Our industry leading 401k will support you in meeting your retirement objectives. Additional benefits include paid parental leave, flexible work policies, opportunities for self-development and paid leave for specific activities. Click here for more information!<p><br></p><strong> EEO </strong><p><br></p>US applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster and its supplement here . CNH Industrial participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. You can view additional information here.<p><br></p>If you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at narecruitingmailbox@cnhind.com.<p><br></p>Read about our company’s commitment to pay transparency by clicking this link: pay transparency notice .<p><br></p>Canada applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, nationality, place of origin, disability, marital status, family status, age, or any other ground prohibited by applicable provincial human rights legislation.
description_json: CNH Industrial is a world-class equipment and services company dedicated to advancing the noble work of agriculture and construction workers. Driven by our shared purpose of Breaking New Ground, we are passionate about bringing Innovation, Sustainability, and Productivity to all that we do. As a truly global company, CNH Industrial’s 37,000+ employees form part of a diverse and inclusive workplace, focused on empowering customers to grow, and build, a better world through our core brands: Case IH, STEYR, New Holland Agriculture, CASE, and New Holland Construction.<p><br></p>In Precision Technology, we make iron smarter. Our team members deliver innovative solutions helping our customers to be more productive, save time, lower costs, and to operate sustainably. From vehicle displays, application controls, steering solutions, digital services and telematics, to fully autonomous driverless technology, we develop solutions that solve challenges for customers around the world.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>As an <strong>Embedded Software Engineer for Auto Guidance applications, </strong>you will become a contributing member of a team, focused on the development of Auto Guidance and GNSS embedded software applications that run on CNHi’s next-generation embedded controllers. The software you create will control various functions of CNHi tractors, sprayers, and harvesters and enable a wide range of Auto guidance features.<p><br><br></p><ul><li>Design, develop, test, and debug software components used for electronically controlled systems on various Agriculture &amp; Forestry products while working within a defined development framework and coding standards</li><li>Participate within a SAFe Agile-based software development team and collaborate with cross-functional product design teams developing various Precision Agriculture features</li><li>Participate in SAFe Agile daily standups, Sprint/PI Planning, Sprint Demos, Retros, and other Sprint Events</li><li>Utilize software tools and electronic instruments to troubleshoot and debug embedded system<br></li></ul><p><br></p>This role pays-$101,000-$146,000 plus any applicable bonus (Actual salaries will vary and will be based on various factors , such as skill, experience and qualification for the role.)<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br><br></p><ul><li>Engineer with 2+ years of career experience, with Bachelors' degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering. 1+ years’ experience with master’s degree. Or equivalent combination of education and experience.</li><li>2+ years of experience designing &amp; developing embedded / electronic systems from concept to release</li><li>Experience in Electrical and/or Software Engineering performing analysis, design, and testing for embedded software projects</li><li>Experience with Embedded C, C++ programming languages<br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br><br></p><ul><li>Experience Model Based Software Design, preferably MathWorks (Simulink/Stateflow/Real-Time Workshop)</li><li>Understanding of Automotive networking protocols such as CAN, J1939</li><li>Experience with embedded systems tools such as compilers, debuggers, simulators, etc.</li><li>Experience with software versioning, repository management, and package management tools</li><li>Experience with continuous integration development, using automated build and test practices</li><li>Experience in embedded systems design with preemptive, multitasking real-time operating systems</li><li>Experience in Embedded Software Development for mobile equipment applications</li><li>Experience with Electro-Hydraulic or vehicle control systems for on/off-highway vehicle systems</li><li>Experience with automated testing (LABview, CAPL, etc)</li><li>Team player who is self-motivated and can work with minimal supervision</li><li>Familiarity with Agile development, Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), or similar methodologies</li><li>Familiarity with Java programming language</li><li>Prior experience with Linux OS (Ubuntu)<br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Company Benefits</strong><p><br></p>CNH Industrial offers a wide variety of benefits that not only encourages wellness and preventive care, but we also provide the right tools and programs to help you achieve it. Our benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. Our industry leading 401k will support you in meeting your retirement objectives. Additional benefits include paid parental leave, flexible work policies, opportunities for self-development and paid leave for specific activities. Click here for more information!<p><br></p><strong> EEO </strong><p><br></p>US applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster and its supplement here . CNH Industrial participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. You can view additional information here.<p><br></p>If you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at narecruitingmailbox@cnhind.com.<p><br></p>Read about our company’s commitment to pay transparency by clicking this link: pay transparency notice .<p><br></p>Canada applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, nationality, place of origin, disability, marital status, family status, age, or any other ground prohibited by applicable provincial human rights legislation.

title: Financial Analyst - Supply Chain Finance (Hybrid)
description: Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, gt.school. Have you got what it takes?<p><br></p>Are you ready to revolutionize education with the power of cutting-edge technology? We're seeking strategic problem solvers who thrive on developing and implementing innovative solutions and are eager to apply the power of generative AI to supercharge their work. Your consistent high performance and dedication will drive our mission to revolutionize education.<p><br></p>At gt.school, we're on a mission to accelerate the pace of learning by 5-10X, harnessing the incredible potential of technology, algorithms, and generative AI. We are creating a platform where students can discover, explore, and learn at an unprecedented rate. You'll play a pivotal role in bringing this vision to life. You'll have the opportunity to build new tools and operational processes, as well as streamline existing workflows for maximum efficiency.<p><br></p>But that's not all! At gt.school, we believe in your growth and development. You'll receive regular coaching and training from a team of global tech experts and operations professionals, ensuring your continuous improvement. We value collaboration and provide a supportive environment where you can meet with team members to work together on exciting projects.<p><br></p>If you're eager for a role that combines research, strategy, product development, and data science in the ever-evolving realm of education and technology, seize the moment and apply below. Let's embark on this exhilarating journey together!<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Engineering generative AI prompts in Python/JavaScript/JSON</li><li>Analyze AI outputs and iterate on prompts to reach desired outcomes</li><li>Leverage generative AI and technology to develop new educational tools, iterate on current products, and finetune AI training models</li><li>Research topics to support the product engineering team</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You Won’t Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collecting data or performing administrative tasks - we have a junior operations analyst team to do this type of work.</li><li>Working on unimportant projects - you'll be tasked with projects that are mission-critical</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Senior Software Engineer Key Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>Create technical functionalities that revolutionize the way education is delivered.<p><br></p><strong><u>Basic Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent written and verbal English communication skills</li><li>Proficient in Python, R, JavaScript, or another OOP language</li><li>2+ years of work experience working in a technical field (science, technology, programming, financial services, data science, etc.)</li><li>Consistently able to work 40 hours per week, Monday through Friday, between 6AM and 6PM CST</li><li>Must be a proactive communicator who can effectively manage multiple priorities and stakeholders simultaneously</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Gt.school</u></strong><p><br></p>gt.school is a stealth EdTech startup in Austin, Texas, the center of educational innovation in the US. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and high-performance life skills coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn 5x faster and unlock their full potential in both academics and in life. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.<p><br></p>There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!<p><br></p><strong>Working with Crossover</strong><p><br></p>This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.<p><br></p><strong>What to expect next:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.</li><li>Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Important!</strong> If you do not receive an email from us:<p><br></p><ul><li>First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.</li><li>Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.</li><li>Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.</li><li>If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.</li></ul> Crossover Job Code: LJ-4880-US-Chicago-SeniorSoftware.003<p><br></p>

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Motion Recruitment, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p>We partnered up with a startup focused on building native applications across platforms including desktop and web by only using JavaScript. They are looking to add a Frontend Developer to the team focused on building out the roadmap and executing it for a successful product future. They are looking for someone heavily experienced with JavaScript and React. They are a remote based company, however they are preferably looking for a candidate located in or around Chicago.<p><br></p>The product they're working on is essential for the future of application innovation and as a growing startup this position will give you ownership of what they are building. If you're looking to be part of a company where your input is critical, this is where you can show off your skills. Required Skills &amp; Experience<p><br></p><ul><li>8 years of experience in developing software </li><li>Heavy experience with JavaScript and React </li><li>Experience working with AWS </li><li>Able to keep up with modern technologies. </li></ul> Desired Skills &amp; Experience<p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to communicate with nontechnical departments. </li><li>Ability to talk in feedback on improving product </li></ul> What You Will Be Doing Tech Breakdown<p><br></p><ul><li>100% Frontend </li></ul> Daily Responsibilities<p><br></p><ul><li>70% Hands On </li><li>30% Team Collaboration </li></ul> The Offer You will receive the following benefits:<p><br></p><ul><li>Medical Insurance </li><li>Dental Benefits </li><li>Vision Benefits </li><li>Paid Time Off (PTO) </li></ul><p><br></p>Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis now and in the future.

title: Java Full Stack Engineer - Professional
description: In a world of disruption and increasingly complex business challenges, our professionals bring truth into focus with the Kroll Lens. Our sharp analytical skills, paired with the latest technology, allow us to give our clients clarity—not just answers—in all areas of business. We embrace diverse backgrounds and global perspectives, and we cultivate diversity by respecting, including, and valuing one another. As part of <em>One team, One Kroll,</em> you’ll contribute to a supportive and collaborative work environment that empowers you to excel.<br><br>Kroll Digital Services (KDS) is Kroll’s digital-first business unit, delivering risk and financial intelligence via technology to the world’s leading companies and financial institutions. We blend the best of both worlds; the agility and experimentation of a start-up, with the stability and backing of an enterprise. We are ambitious in both our mission and our culture.<br><br>The FinTech arm of KDS was recently brought together with some of the industry’s leading experts to build cutting edge applications and data products that will revolutionize the way private markets professionals analyze and manage illiquid assets.<br><br>You will be a critical member of the KDS team, helping to design and create leading-edge solutions for our clients.<br><br><strong>RESPONSIBILITIES: <br></strong><ul><li>Develop technology driven financial platforms to solve client problems</li><li>Build these platforms from the ground up with a global team</li><li>Determine and help build appropriate pipelines to deploy high quality code in mission-critical production environments</li><li>Continually improve the reliability, stability, and performance of production engineering processes that power the product offering</li><li>Beyond engineering, strive to learn the business context to quickly play a leading role in solving problems and driving decisions<br><br></li></ul><strong>REQUIREMENTS: <br></strong><ul><li>BA/BS degree in computer science or relevant degree or work experience</li><li>2+ years of application development experience with .NET and C#</li><li>2+ years of experience with JavaScript frameworks like React or Angular</li><li>2+ years of experience with Web services (SOAP, REST) &amp; Web API / Integrations</li><li>2+ years of experience with Database design / development</li><li>Strong in Object Oriented Programming, MVC, Design patterns and SOLID principles</li><li>Experience in building &amp; hosting applications on the Cloud</li><li>Experience with HTML5, CSS, Bootstrap, and other related frameworks</li><li>Experience with version control tools</li><li>Experience with CI-CD pipelines using Azure DevOps or comparable tools</li><li>Experience with app. lifecycle management using Azure DevOps or comparable tools</li><li>Excellent communication skills in written and oral English</li><li>Familiarity with Scrum and Agile methodologies<br><br></li></ul><strong>Skills to be outstanding:<br></strong><ul><li>Experience in the financial industry, specifically capital markets, asset management, or private market technology</li><li>Experience in building public facing web applications and API’s</li><li>Experience with deploying and managing services using container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes or Docker</li><li>Experience delivering and receiving content as JSON</li><li>Experience in building solutions with monitoring, logging, security, and high availability considerations</li><li>Experience in developing solutions that require data isolation for privacy</li><li>Experience with Azure services including App Services, Azure Functions, Web Jobs, Key Vault, Storage (blob), App Insights</li><li>Experience with one of the following: Swagger, Postman, MuleSoft or Kong</li><li> Experience designing, developing, and maintaining Excel and other add-ins for platforms selling into the financial industry</li><li>Technical certifications (especially in Cloud Technologies)</li><li>Experience with Auth0 / Azure Active Directory / IAM<br><br></li></ul>In order to be considered for a position, you must formally apply via careers.kroll.com.<br><br><em>Kroll is committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants regardless of gender, gender identity, race, religion, color, nationality, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, age or disability.<br><br></em>The current salary range for this position is $90,000 - $150,000.<br><br>#dice<br><br>

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants regardless of gender, gender identity, race, religion, color, nationality, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, age or disability.<br><br></em>The current salary range for this position is $90,000 - $150,000.<br><br>#dice<br><br>

title: Senior Software Engineer, gt.school (Remote) - $60,000/year USD
description: Aha! helps companies build lovable software. We provide the world's #1 product development tools — Aha! Roadmaps , Aha! Ideas , Aha! Notebooks , and Aha! Develop — which are used by more than 700,000 builders. Product teams rely on our expertise, guided templates, and training programs via Aha! Academy to be their best. We are proud to be a very different type of high-growth SaaS company. The business is self-funded, profitable, and 100 percent remote. We are recognized as one of the best fully remote companies to work for, champion the Bootstrap Movement , and have given over $1M to people in need through Aha! Cares . Learn more at www.aha.io .<p><br></p><strong>Our team</strong><p><br></p>Aha! engineering is a mid-sized, fully remote team that is highly productive. We are centered around North American time zones so we can collaborate during the workday.<p><br></p><ul><li>We help each other grow: We each bring unique skills to the table and want our teammates to feel valued from the start. Our onboarding program exposes new hires to the codebase and lets them contribute right away. </li><li>We move quickly: We ship code multiple times a day. We believe in getting valuable features in front of customers and iteratively improving as we learn what works and what does not. </li><li>We value product over process: We want the team to have the time and focus on solving complex challenges. We minimize the overhead by setting clear goals and avoiding heavyweight processes and excessive meetings.</li><li>We share knowledge freely: We share our learnings with each other and with the developer community. Our engineering blog demonstrates how we tackle interesting challenges at Aha! </li><li>We enjoy: We like what we do. And we want you to love your team and your job too. Learn more about The Responsive Method , our company values , and the generous benefits we offer.</li></ul><strong>Our technology</strong><p><br></p>Our web application is a single-instance, multi-tenant Ruby on Rails monolith supported by Postgres (database), Redis (background jobs), and memcached (Rails caching). We also run a Node.js webserver to support collaborative editing and real-time updates. Our application is hosted on Amazon Web Services and architected with ECS for reproducibility and scalability.<p><br></p>We utilize a growing amount of React on the front end to build rich client-side experiences, including our fully collaborative text editor and our slide presentation editor. We balance the strengths of both technologies — Rails for its conventions and simplicity and React for more powerful interactive functionality.<p><br></p>We embrace new technologies that help us deliver a lovable product, but we also remain cognizant of the maintenance overhead that a new library or platform brings. We solve the problems in front of us rather than prematurely optimizing to address issues that may never materialize.<p><br></p>We do most of our planning and collaboration in Aha! Roadmaps and built Aha! Develop so that software engineers and their teams could take advantage of those same rich features. We use Slack and Zoom for video calls. (Email? Rarely.)<p><br></p><strong><u>Your Experience</u></strong><p><br></p>Most of our features involve writing significant Ruby on Rails code, so you should have experience working in a Rails codebase. We also write a lot of React but we are happy to help you learn that part on the job.<p><br></p><strong><u>You Also Have The Below Experience And Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>We believe that being a kind person who elevates the rest of the team is just as valuable as writing great code. You have strong problem-solving skills and experience working on important functionality for a cloud-based product. You are humble, eager to learn, and always willing to help others. You want teammates who enjoy solving problems regardless of the technologies and techniques involved. You have worked at meaningful scale before and want to do so again.<p><br></p><ul><li>2+ years of experience working in Ruby on Rails</li><li>Experience producing scalable, efficient, and maintainable code</li><li>Experience building features (ideally at a high-growth SaaS company)</li><li>Active collaborator with product teams</li></ul><strong>Your work at Aha!</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>As a Ruby On Rails Engineer, Your Work Will Include</u></strong><p><br></p>We work on a broad range of features across the full stack.<p><br></p><ul><li>Implementing new features for our users, touching each layer of the MVC as needed</li><li>Building deeply interactive reporting interfaces using React</li><li>Working proactively with product and UX to refine and iterate on specifications as the feature takes shape</li><li>Investigating slow performance and optimizing queries to ensure Aha! is snappy and satisfying to use</li><li>Interfacing directly with users to quickly squash bugs as part of our regular customer support rotation </li><li>Documenting components in our style guide to help drive consistency</li></ul><p><br></p>If this role sounds appealing, we would love to hear from you. (A real human reviews every application.)<p><br></p><strong>Grow with us</strong><p><br></p>Everyone deserves to reach their fullest potential. We know that when we do work that matters with people we care about in a high-growth environment, we feel engaged and alive. And our goal is to help you do just that. We offer all the benefits you would expect and more, including profit sharing. The specific benefits listed below are reflective of what we offer U.S.-based hires. We also do our best to extend identical benefits to international teammates.<p><br></p><ul><li>The base salary range for this role in the US is between $100,000 and $160,000</li><li>Cash-based compensation also includes profit sharing and we contribute a percentage of your total pay each month towards your retirement</li><li>Medical, dental, and vision plans — for many teammates, we cover 100 percent of the premiums</li><li>Up to 200 hours of paid time off a year to spend however you want</li><li>30 to 90 days of paid parental leave and five to 10 days of paid care and bereavement leave</li><li>Up to $1,000 annually for third-party education, along with paid time off to immerse yourself in learning</li><li>Volunteer opportunities throughout the year</li></ul><p><br></p>Base salary and total compensation are dependent upon many factors, such as: skills, experience, and relevant past roles

title: Java Full Stack Engineer - Professional
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Motion Recruitment, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p>Do you want to make a real-world impact in the healthcare space and get the chance to work with highly scalable applications? An extremely stable Chicago based company is looking for a Fullstack Engineer that has experience with Java, Spring Boot, React/Angular/JavaScript, and AWS.<p><br></p>This company fosters a collaborative and learning environment!<p><br></p><strong>Required Skills &amp; Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BS or greater in CS or related field </li><li>3 to 5 years of engineering experience with Java </li><li>3 to 5 years with JavaScript (React JS, Angular, or Node JS) </li><li>Experience with Spring Framework </li><li>Microservice and REST service experience </li></ul> Desired Skills &amp; Experience<p><br></p><ul><li>Cloud experience preferably AWS </li><li>Familiarity with AI/ML </li></ul> What You Will Be Doing<p><br></p>Tech Breakdown<p><br></p><ul><li>50% Java </li><li>50% Angular/React </li></ul> Daily Responsibilities<p><br></p><ul><li>100% Hands On </li></ul> The Offer<p><br></p>You will receive the following benefits:<p><br></p><ul><li>Health Insurance Benefits </li><li>Dental Benefits </li><li>Vision Benefits </li><li>Sick Time </li><li>401(k) </li></ul> Make Real World Impact/Java/React/Angular/Fully Remote<p><br></p>
